record_data.record_plain_text: Chisholm View Wind Project, LLC FERC FPA Electric Tariff Agreements Effective Date: November 15, 2016 Shared Facilities Agreement Option Code A EXHIBIT A Shared Facilities Agreement by and among Chisholm View Wind Project, LLC, Chisholm View Wind Project II, LLC, and Enel Green Power North America, Inc. Execution Version SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT between CHISHOLM VIEW WIND PROJECT, LLC and CHISHOLM VIEW WIND PROJECT II, LLC and ENEL GREEN POWER NORTH AMERICA, INC. November 11, 2016 INDEX OF EXHIBITS AND SCHEDULES Exhibit A Shared Facilities Exhibit A-1 CV1 Land Parcels Exhibit B Percentage Interest of Lessor and Lessee Exhibit C Insurance Requirements Exhibit D Dispute Resolution Procedures Exhibit E Form of Memorandum of Shared Facilities Agreement Schedule 2.2 Purchase Price Calculation Schedule 6.15 Metering Protocol SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT THIS SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT (this “Agreement”) is entered into as of November 11, 2016 (the “Effective Date”), by and between CHISHOLM VIEW WIND PROJECT, LLC, a New York limited liability company (“CV1”), CHISHOLM VIEW WIND PROJECT II, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“CV2”) and Enel Green Power North America, Inc., a Delaware corporation (“Enel”). Each of CV1 and CV2 are referred to herein as a “Party,” and collectively CV1 and CV2 are referred to as the “Parties,” in each case both in their respective capacities as owners and operators of the “Projects,” as defined below, and as, respectively, “Lessor” and “Lessee,” in each case in their capacity as lessor or lessee of the Shared Facilities (as applicable). CV2 and Enel are referred to herein collectively as the “Enel Parties.” CV1 also is referred to herein as “Manager” in its capacity as the initial “Manager,” as defined below, subject to any subsequent change in the Manager in accordance with this Agreement. RECITALS: A. CV1 owns and operates a 235.2 MW rated capacity wind generation facility located in Grant and Garfield Counties, Oklahoma and that consists of wind turbine generators, foundations and towers and associated collection and interconnection lines and related facilities and improvements (the “CV1 Project”). B. CV2, which is a subsidiary of Enel, desires to install, own and operate an up to 64.8 MW wind generation facility (the “CV2 Project”), which will be constructed in Grant and Garfield Counties, Oklahoma, adjacent to the CV1 Project. Together, the CV1 Project and CV2 Project shall be referred to as the “Projects.” C. CV1 owns, operates, and maintains a 345 kV substation, interconnection line and other associated facilities, including a switchyard, breakers, substation, capacitor banks, SCADA and WindControl systems and metering, connecting the CV1 Project to the transmission system and balancing authority area controlled by the Southwest Power Pool, Inc. (“SPP”) and owned by Oklahoma Gas and Electric (“OGE”), all more particularly described in Article 1 as the “Shared Facilities”. The Shared Facilities were constructed according to a Generator Interconnection Agreement among CV1, SPP, and OGE, dated July 8 2010, for 300 MW of interconnection service (as amended by letter agreements dated August 11, 2011, September 17, 2012, August 6, 2013 and July 15, 2016, the “GIA”), as it may be further amended or restated. As of the Effective Date, CV1 owns one hundred percent (100%) of the interests in the Shared Facilities. D. CV1 owns or leases approximately 42,000 acres of land which includes the parcels more particularly described in Exhibit A-1 (“CV1 Parcels”). In connection with the Shared Facilities, the parties desire to grant each other certain subeasement and/or access rights for the purposes of constructing, owning, operating and maintaining the Projects and the Shared Facilities. E. CV1 and CV2 desire for CV2 to lease the Shared Facilities from CV1 to the extent needed for, and in order to support, CV2’s development and operation of the CV2 Project. F. The Parties wish to set forth herein their respective rights and obligations regarding such CV2 lease rights, joint use, maintenance, repair, replacement of, and alterations to the Shared Facilities. G. The Parties also wish to provide for the appointment of a Manager for the provision of certain services with respect to the Shared Facilities, at such time and on the terms and conditions contained herein. AGREEMENT: NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants contained in this Agreement and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is acknowledged, the Parties and Enel agree as follows: 1. DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATION 1.1 Definitions. Unless otherwise noted, capitalized terms not defined in the body of this Agreement have the following meanings. “Affiliate” means, with respect to any Party, any Person directly or indirectly controlling, controlled by or under common control with such Party. “Affiliate Service Provider” means any Affiliate of the Manager providing services related to the management, use, operation, maintenance and repair of Shared Facilities pursuant to a separate written agreement with the Manager. “Agreement” has the meaning set forth in the preamble above. “Annual Shared Facilities Budget” has the meaning set forth in Section 8.6. “BOP Operator” means the Operator, as identified in the Operations and Management Agreement, dated as of December 13, 2012, between CHI Power, Inc. and CV1. “Build-Out Agreement” means that certain Build-Out Agreement, dated as of November 9, 2016, among CV1, CV2 and Enel Kansas, LLC. “Business Day” means any day other than Saturday, Sunday or any federal holiday. “Casualty Event” means an event that causes all or a portion of the Shared Facilities to be damaged, destroyed or rendered unfit for normal use for any reason whatsoever. “Condemnation Event” means any compulsory transfer or taking or transfer under threat of compulsory transfer or taking of all or a material part of the Shared Facilities by any Governmental Authority or entity acting under power of eminent domain. “Confidential Information”, with respect to a given Disclosing Party and the respective Receiving Party, means, collectively and individually, all data, materials and information (including software, data, technology, know-how, trade secrets, processes, ideas, inventions (whether patentable or not), prototypes, schematics, design plans, drawings, pricing information, customer and service provider lists, business arrangements, business information, financial information, financial results, technical information, analyses, forecasts, compilations, studies, contracts, agreements, and planning or strategy information) provided by or on behalf of a Party or Enel (each Party or Enel in such capacity, a “Disclosing Party”) to the other Party or Enel (each Party or Enel in such capacity, a “Receiving Party”) or the Receiving Party’s Representatives, or to which the Receiving Party or the Receiving Party’s Representatives are given access by or on behalf of the Disclosing Party, whether verbally or in written or electronic form, related to the Disclosing Party, any Project, the Shared Facilities, or the Parties in connection with this Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Confidential Information under this Agreement does not include any information that: (a) is now publicly available, or that later becomes publicly available through no action by the Receiving Party or the Receiving Party’s Representatives in violation of this Agreement; (b) is already in the possession of the Receiving Party or the Receiving Party’s Representatives (other than Enel) and is not, to Receiving Party’s knowledge, subject to a confidentiality or fiduciary obligation at the time of the information’s disclosure under this Agreement; (c) is lawfully received from any source other than the Disclosing Party or the Disclosing Party’s Representatives under circumstances not involving, to the Receiving Party’s knowledge, a breach of any fiduciary or confidentiality obligation; or (d) is independently developed by or for the Receiving Party or the Receiving Party’s Representatives (other than Enel) without reference to, or the use of, any portion of the Confidential Information. “CV1” has the meaning set forth in the introductory paragraph. “CV1 Manager” means the Manager, as identified in the Management Services Agreement, dated as of December 13, 2012, between Enel and CV1. “CV1 Parcels” has the meaning set forth in Recital D. “CV1 PPA” means that certain Agreement for the Purchase of Energy from a Renewable Resource, dated as of June 7, 2011, by and between CV1 and Alabama Power Company, an Alabama corporation, as amended by that certain Letter Agreement regarding Agreement for the Purchase of Energy from a Renewable Resource, dated as of April 23, 2013, between Alabama Power Company and CV1. “CV1 Project” has the meaning set forth in the Recitals. “CV1 Substation” has the meaning set forth on Exhibit A attached hereto. “CV2” has the meaning set forth in the introductory paragraph. “CV2 PPA” means that certain Power Purchase Agreement, dated as of November 9, 2015, between Arkansas Electric Cooperative Corporation and CV2 (as assignee of Enel Kansas, LLC pursuant to that certain Assignment and Assumption Agreement, dated as of September 28, 2016, among Enel Kansas, LLC, CV2 and Arkansas Electric Cooperative Corporation), as amended by that certain Side Letter dated July 20, 2016, between Arkansas Electric Cooperative Corporation and Enel Kansas, LLC, and as further amended by that certain Side Letter dated September 28, 2016, between Arkansas Electric Cooperative Corporation and CV2. “CV2 Project” has the meaning set forth in the Recitals. “CV2 Project COD” means the “Commercial Operation Date” (as defined in the CV2 PPA). “CV2 Purchase Option” has the meaning set forth in Section 2.2. “Default Rate” means a rate per annum equal to the lesser of (a) a varying rate per annum equal to the sum of (i) the three-month LIBOR as published in The Wall Street Journal, with adjustments in that varying rate to be made on the same date as any change in that rate is so published, plus (ii) three percent per annum, and (b) the maximum rate permitted by Law. “Disclosing Party” has the meaning set forth in the definition of “Confidential Information.” “Dispute” means any controversy, claim or dispute that arises out of or in connection with this Agreement or the construction, interpretation, performance, breach, termination, enforceability or validity of this Agreement, whether the same is based on rights, privileges or interests recognized by or based upon statute, contract, agreement (whether written or oral), tort, common law or other Law. “Effective Date” has the meaning set forth in the preamble above. “Election Date” has the meaning set forth in Section 2.2. “Election Notice” has the meaning set forth in Section 2.2. “Emergency” shall mean any occurrence, in the reasonable judgment of Manager, Lessor or Lessee, that may arise that requires immediate action and which constitutes a serious actual or potential hazard to the safety of Persons or property, that may materially interfere with the safe, economical or environmentally sound operation of the Shared Facilities or any Project, or that would violate any applicable Law or Governmental Approval or any directive by a Governmental Authority or SPP. “Enel” has the meaning set forth in the introductory paragraph. “Enel Parties” has the meaning set forth in the introductory paragraph. “Environmental Laws” means all Laws, whenever enacted or in effect concerning pollution, protection of human health, safety or the environment or preservation or reclamation of natural resources (including endangered or threatened species),or relating to the use, storage, disposal, generation and transportation of Hazardous Substances or imposing liability for injury to human health, property or the environment. “Event of Default” has the meaning set forth in Section 14.1. “EWG” means an “exempt wholesale generator,” as such term is defined in Section 1262(6) of the Public Utility Holding Company Act of 2005 and the FERC’s regulations at 18 C.F.R. Pt. 366.1. “FERC” means the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission or its successor agency. “Financing Party” means any Person providing direct or indirect debt or equity financing, refinancing or extending credit (including any financing lease) to Lessor or Lessee. “Force Majeure” means acts of God or any other casualty or occurrence, condition, event or circumstance of any kind or nature not reasonably within the affected Party’s control and which could not have been avoided by reasonable measures or foreseeable by the affected Party, including strikes, slow-downs or labor difficulties, fires, flood, earthquakes, explosions, natural disasters, or other hazards, acts of public enemies, riots, civil commotions, insurrection, or war. Force Majeure expressly does not include: any delay in performing or failure of performance of any contractual provision by a Party (except to the extent caused by a Force Majeure event); late delivery or breakage of equipment or materials (except to the extent caused by a Force Majeure event); or economic hardship. “GIA’’ has the meaning set forth in Recital C above. “GIA Amendment” has the meaning set forth in Section 6.4.2. “Governmental Approval” means any permit, license, certificate, concession, approval, consent, ratification, permission, clearance, confirmation, exemption, waiver, franchise, certification, designation, rating, registration, variance, qualification, accreditation or authorization issued, granted, given or otherwise made available by or under the authority of any Governmental Authority or pursuant to any Law. “Governmental Authority” means any court, tribunal, authority, agency, commission, official or other instrumentality, including regulatory authorities and bodies, of the United States or any state, county, city or other political subdivision, any quasi-governmental regulatory authority, such as NERC or its regional reliability organizations acting under delegated authority, arbitrator or any judicial or quasi judicial tribunal of competent jurisdiction. “Hazardous Substances” means: (a) any hazardous materials, hazardous wastes, hazardous substances, toxic wastes, solid wastes, and toxic substances as those or similar terms are defined under any Environmental Laws; (b) any asbestos or asbestos containing material; (c) polychlorinated biphenyls (“PCBs”), or PCB containing materials or fluids; (d) radon; (e) any petroleum, petroleum hydrocarbons, petroleum products, crude oil and any fractions or derivatives thereof; and (f) any other hazardous, radioactive, toxic or noxious substance, material, pollutant, or contaminant that, whether by its nature or its use, or exposure to is subject to regulation or could give rise to liability under any Environmental Laws. “Indemnified Parties” has the meaning set forth in Section 11.1. “Laws” means any applicable constitutional provisions, statutes, acts, codes, laws, rules, regulations, ordinances, orders, decrees, rulings, judgments or decisions of a Governmental Authority or arbitral body. “Lease 32” means “Agreement No. 1232100; Lease No. 32” listed in Exhibit A-1 attached hereto, as amended from time to time. “Lease 58” means the “Agreement No. 1370000; Lease No. 58” listed in Exhibit A-1 attached hereto, as amended from time to time. “Lease Interest” has the meaning set forth in Section 3.2.1. “Lessee” has the meaning set forth in the preamble above. “Lessor” has the meaning set forth in the preamble above. “Liabilities” means any and all claims, actions, debts, losses, liabilities, damages, expenses, awards, judgments, settlement payments, fines, penalties, costs, royalties, assessments (tax or otherwise), proceedings, deficiencies or obligations, whether civil or criminal, including those arising out of any investigation, action, claim, settlement, compromise, judgment or award, by any Person, of any nature, whether known or unknown, absolute, accrued, contingent or otherwise and whether due or to become due, and whether or not resulting from third party claims, and any out-of-pocket costs and expenses (including court costs and fees, reasonable legal counsels’, accountants’, or other fees and expenses) incurred in defending against or investigating any of the same. “Liens” means all mortgages, deeds of trust, liens, debentures, security interests, pledges, conditional sale contracts, proceedings, judgment liens, orders, rights of first refusal, charges and other encumbrances or restrictions of any kind, whether recorded or unrecorded. “Loss Event” means a Casualty Event or a Condemnation Event. “Lost PTC Value” means, with respect to any reduced or lost energy production, the amount, in dollars, equal to the PTCs to which Lessor or Lessee or their respective partners, members, Affiliates or tax investors would have been entitled with respect to the amount of energy production reduced or lost, and a gross up amount (calculated using the highest marginal U.S. and state income tax rates then applicable to domestic corporations) to take into account the federal and state corporate income tax to Lessor or Lessee or their respective partners, members, Affiliates or tax investors on the payment of the amount set forth above in lieu of the PTCs (such that the aggregate after-tax amount is equal to amount in dollars of the PTCs to which the Company, its partners, members, Affiliates or tax investors would have been entitled with respect to the lost or reduced energy production). “Major Decisions” means: (a) any sale, lease or other voluntary disposition of the Shared Facilities; (b) any amendment or modification to the terms of the GIA, any waiver of material rights under the GIA or the termination of the GIA; (c) any transfer or assignment of the GIA; (d) any initiation or settlement of any dispute under the GIA; (e) any encumbrance or grant of any lien on the Shared Facilities or the GIA other than Permitted Liens; (f) any action that would materially and adversely change or impact the regulatory status of Lessor or Lessee or the Shared Facilities; (g) any material capital expenditures, except in an Emergency; or (h) any action that would materially and adversely impact Lessor’s or Lessee’s interest in the Shared Facilities. “Manager” has the meaning set forth in Section 7.1. “Manager Representative” has the meaning set forth in Section 8.12. “Metering Protocol” has the meaning set forth in Section 6.15. “NERC” means the North American Electric Reliability Corporation. “Network Upgrades” has the meaning set forth in the GIA. “OandM Building” has the meaning set forth on Exhibit A attached hereto. “OGE” has the meaning given in Recital C. “Ownership Interest” has the meaning set forth in Section 3.2.1. “Parties” and “Party” have the respective meanings set forth in the preamble above. “Percentage Interest” means the percentage as set forth on Exhibit B attached hereto with respect to Lessor and Lessee, which percentage is intended to reflect the respective proportion of the Shared Facilities to be used and accessed by Lessor and Lessee pursuant to this Agreement. “Permitted Liens” means: (a) Liens for taxes that (i) are not yet delinquent or (ii) are being contested in good faith by appropriate proceedings, so long as any such proceeding does not involve any substantial danger of the sale, forfeiture or loss of any part of the Shared Facilities; (b) Liens in favor of carriers, warehousemen, mechanics, materialmen, repairmen or other like Liens that (i) arise in the ordinary course of business of and for amounts that are not yet due or (ii) are being contested in good faith by appropriate proceedings, so long as any such proceeding does not involve any substantial danger of the sale, forfeiture or loss of any part of the Shared Facilities; or (c) Liens in favor of Financing Parties permitted pursuant to Section 17.2.1. “Person” means any individual, partnership, joint stock company, corporation, limited liability company, trust, unincorporated association or joint venture, any Governmental Authority, or any other entity. “Point of Interconnection” has the meaning set forth in the GIA. “Point of Change of Ownership” has the meaning set forth in the GIA. “Project” means, with respect to CV2, the CV2 Project, or, with respect to CV1, the CV1 Project. “Project Site” means the real property on which the applicable Project is located. “Project Specific Assets” means, for each Project, any of the assets comprising such Project, the Project Site underlying such Project and the agreements and contractual arrangements related to such Project and Project Site. For the avoidance of doubt, the Project Specific Assets shall exclude any of the Shared Facilities. “Prudent Industry Practices” means any of the practices, methods, and standards of care, skill, safety and diligence, as the same may change from time to time, but applied in light of the facts known at the time, as are generally applied or utilized under comparable circumstances by reasonably experienced and prudent professionals in respect of the design, development, construction, commissioning, maintenance, financing and operation of electric generating facilities and electric transmission facilities located in the United States of America of comparable type and complexity to the applicable Projects and the Shared Facilities. “Prudent Industry Practices” do not necessarily mean the best practice, method, or standard of care, skill, safety and diligence in all cases, but is instead intended to encompass a range of acceptable practices, methods, and standards. “PTCs” means the production tax credits with respect to a Project allowed by Section 45 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (as amended from time to time) or any successor to such section for generating electricity from renewable sources. “Purchase Price” has the meaning set forth in Section 2.2. “Receiving Party” has the meaning set forth in the definition of “Confidential Information.” “Removal Costs” means any costs, expenses or other Liabilities associated with the decommissioning or removal of the Shared Facilities upon the cessation of operations of the Projects. “Representatives” means, with respect to a Party, such Party’s Affiliates, officers, directors, managers, members, shareholders, partners, employees, lenders (actual or prospective), investors (actual or prospective), transferees of the Ownership Interest or Lease Interest, as applicable, (actual or prospective), purchasers (actual or prospective), contractors, vendors, suppliers, advisors, consultants, agents and representatives. “Required Consent” means a unanimous decision by Lessor and Lessee. “Restoration Proposal” has the meaning set forth in Section 8.11.2. “Shared Expenses” means (i) the Shared Facility Lease Payment and (ii) costs, expenses (including labor expenses) and other Liabilities arising under or relating to the Shared Facilities, including any costs, expenses and other Liabilities of the Manager or its Affiliates attributable to the performance of Manager’s duties as Manager, but excluding (a) the cost and expense of any Project Specific Assets and the connection and integration of Project Specific Assets with any Shared Facilities (including any design, procurement, construction or installation costs); (b) any costs and expenses to restore or repair the Shared Facilities arising from Lessor’s or Lessee’s actions or inactions in violation of this Agreement or a Governmental Approval, (c) any costs or expenses incurred in connection with Section 3.6, or (d) the cost and expense of any Network Upgrades required to connect and integrate any Project Specific Assets with the transmission system. “Shared Facility Lease Payment” means the payment due to a Lessor (as such term is defined in the applicable lease) in the aggregate amount of the sum of (i) the payment for the CV1 Substation pursuant to Section 6.5.4 of Lease 32, (ii) the acreage payment pursuant to Section 6.2.1(a) of Lease 32 for the tracts leased thereunder and described in Exhibit A-1 attached hereto, (iii) the payment for the OandM Building pursuant to Section 6.5.5 of Lease 58, and (iv) the acreage payment pursuant to Section 6.2.1(a) of Lease 58 for the tracts leased thereunder and described in Exhibit A-1 attached hereto. “Shared Facilities” has the meaning set forth on Exhibit A attached hereto. “Shared Facilities Representative” has the meaning set forth in Section 5.2. “SPP” has the meaning set forth in Recital C. “Termination Event” has the meaning set forth in Section 17.3. “Transco” means an entity formed, and co-owned pro rata based on the Percentage Interests, by CV1 and CV2 in the implementation of the Transco Structure. “Transco Structure” means (a) the formation of a Transco and negotiation of an operating agreement for Transco, (b) the assignment by CV1 to the Transco of the GIA and, to the extent agreed upon by CV1 and CV2, any portion or all of the Shared Facilities, (c) the amendment of the GIA to reflect the Transco as the “Interconnection Customer” (as such term is defined in the GIA) and, if applicable, any related modifications relating to the ownership of the Shared Facilities and (d) the appointment of the Transco as the Manager under this Agreement (including arrangements for the BOP Operator or other appropriate party to manage the Shared Facilities). “Transfer” means to grant, sell, assign, set over, deliver, convey, demise, dispose of or otherwise transfer an interest in tangible or intangible assets. “Undivided Interest” has the meaning set forth in Section 2.2. “Withdrawal Date” has the meaning set forth in Section 6.14.1. “Withdrawal Notice” has the meaning set forth in Section 6.14.1. 2. TERM; PURCHASE PRICE; AND CONDITIONS PRECEDENT 2.1 Effective Date. This Agreement will commence on the Effective Date and remain in full force and effect following the Effective Date until the first occurrence of (a) the mutual agreement of all Lessor and Lessee to terminate this Agreement, or (b) otherwise as provided under this Agreement. 2.2 CV2 Purchase Option. CV2 has a one-time option (the “CV2 Purchase Option”) to elect to purchase an undivided ownership interest in 21.6% of the Shared Facilities (the “Undivided Interest”). The CV2 Purchase Option may be exercised by CV2 at any time after January 1, 2017 by delivering to CV1: (a) a written notice (the “Election Notice”) in which CV2 confirms, as of the date specified in the Election Notice (the “Election Date”) that FERC approval (if applicable) has been obtained in connection with the grant, sale, transfer, assignment and conveyance to it of its Undivided Interest; and (b) the purchase price (the “Purchase Price”) of the Undivided Interest. The Purchase Price shall be calculated based on the schedule set forth as Schedule 2.2. The Purchase Price shall be payable in U.S. dollars to CV1 by wire transfer in immediately available funds to an account specified by CV1. Following the exercise of the CV2 Purchase Option, each of the Parties and Enel will work in good faith to amend and restate this Agreement to (w) reflect that CV2 owns the Undivided Interest as of the Election Date, (x) remove references to CV2 having a leasehold interest in the Shared Facilities, (y) appoint the BOP Operator to manage the Shared Facilities (and, in the event the Transco Structure has been implemented pursuant to Section 6.4.4, appoint the BOP Operator or other appropriate party to manage the facilities on behalf of Transco) and (z) reflect the Parties’ agreement regarding the allocation of any interruption, reduction in deliveries of, or other curtailment of electrical power through the Shared Facilities, or to the common point of interconnection designated in the GIA. 2.3 Conditions Precedent to Shared Use. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, CV1 shall have no obligation to provide CV2 with any right to transmit electricity over the Shared Facilities under this Agreement until Lessor and Lessee have filed this Agreement with FERC for acceptance under Section 205 of the Federal Power Act with an effective date on or before CV1 provides such right to CVII. 3. SHARED FACILITIES 3.1 Shared Facilities. CV1 shall operate, and maintain the Shared Facilities that, as of the Effective Date, are governed by this Agreement. 3.2 Grant of Lease in Shared Facilities. 3.2.1 Effective upon the Effective Date, upon and subject to the terms, conditions, restrictions and reservations set forth in this Agreement, CV1 hereby leases to CV2 an undivided twenty-one and six tenths percent (21.6%) leasehold interest in and to the Shared Facilities owned or hereafter acquired by CV1 (the “Lease Interest”), AS IS, WITH ALL FAULTS AND WITHOUT ANY REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES WHATSOEVER, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, AND SPECIFICALLY EXCLUDING ANY WARRANTY OF TITLE, MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR ANY OTHER WARRANTY ARISING UNDER STATUTORY OR COMMON LAW, while at the same time reserving to itself 100% ownership interest in and to such Shared Facilities (the “Ownership Interest”). 3.2.2 On the Effective Date, or within a reasonable time thereafter, CV1 shall deliver to CV2 any other notices, instruments, documents, agreements or consents as are reasonably necessary in connection with the Lease Interest. 3.3 Access to Shared Facilities. Each of Lessor and Lessee and their respective Representatives shall have access to the Shared Facilities (a) for inspection of the Shared Facilities, (b) for any required maintenance and repairs of the Shared Facilities as agreed to by Lessor, Lessee and the Manager, if applicable, and (c) in connection with the operation of the Shared Facilities, all in accordance with this Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, except in the event of an Emergency, each of Lessor and Lessee shall provide no less than 24 hours’ prior notice to the other Party (and the Manager, if applicable) of its or any of its Representative’s intent to access the Shared Facilities and the planned scope of work requiring such access, and each of Lessor and Lessee shall provide no less than 48 hours’ prior notice to the other Party (and the Manager, if applicable) prior to performing any maintenance or repairs pursuant to clause (b) above. Each of Lessor and Lessee and any of their respective Representatives shall: (i) follow all applicable safety, security and site rules established by the Manager; and (ii) comply with all applicable real estate restrictions, applicable Law and Governmental Approvals when on the premises or accessing the Shared Facilities, except to the extent that following any such rule would violate applicable Law. In the event of an Emergency, prior notice is not required to access the Shared Facilities to respond to the Emergency, but Lessor or Lessee (as applicable) shall provide notice of access to, and coordinate with, Manager (if applicable) and the other Party as soon as reasonably practicable thereafter. 3.4 No Interference, Cooperation; Quiet Enjoyment and Over-Burdening. Lessor’s or Lessee’s use of the Shared Facilities or the operation of its Project shall not interfere with the use and enjoyment by the other Party of its respective rights in such Shared Facilities or the operation of its Project, except as specifically provided herein. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, including Section 6.14 below, each of Lessor and Lessee hereby consents to the development and operation of the Projects, and each of Lessor and Lessee shall cooperate in good faith to accommodate the other Party’s use of the Shared Facilities for the benefit of the Projects as contemplated by this Agreement. Neither Lessor nor Lessee will use or permit the use of the Shared Facilities in any manner that would create waste or nuisance, or that would jeopardize the issuance or maintenance of any insurance policy relating to the Shared Facilities or any Governmental Approval as to the Shared Facilities or any Project, nor otherwise conduct or permit to be conducted operations on its Project Site which would have similar effects on, or otherwise damage or interfere with, the Shared Facilities. All costs and expenses associated with Lessor or Lessee interconnecting a Project into the Shared Facilities shall be for the account of, and paid for, by such Party. 3.5 Connection of Project to Shared Facilities. Each of Lessor and Lessee connecting its own Project to the Shared Facilities shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless the other Party from all Liabilities, including third party claims, property and revenue losses incurred, as a result of such activity, to the extent such claims and damages are not covered by the insurance required by Article 12. 3.6 Grant of Easements. CV1 hereby irrevocably grants to CV2 and its successors and assigns, subject to the terms of this Agreement, sub-easements and sublease rights over, across and under the CV1 Parcels for the purposes of constructing, operating and maintaining the Shared Facilities and ingress and egress over and across all access roads on the CV1 Parcels for access thereto. 3.7 Memorandum. Concurrently with the execution and delivery of this Agreement, the Parties will execute and deliver a Memorandum of Shared Facilities Agreement in the form attached as Exhibit E, which Memorandum of Shared Facilities Agreement will promptly thereafter be recorded in the official records of Grant and Garfield Counties, Oklahoma. Upon or promptly after termination or expiration of this Agreement, the Parties will execute and deliver a notice of termination of this Agreement for recording in the official records of Grant and Garfield Counties, Oklahoma. 4. SHARED EXPENSES 4.1 Liabilities for the Account of Lessor and Lessee. Except as specifically set forth in this Agreement, each of Lessor and Lessee shall be solely responsible for its Liabilities relating to its Project and Project Specific Assets, including all Liabilities arising from acquiring, designing, installing, constructing, using, operating, maintaining and repairing its Project Specific Assets, and the cost of any future Network Upgrades associated with any Project or Project Specific Assets. Each of Lessor and Lessee shall solely have rights to any reimbursements owing, if any, from SPP or OGE (or a successor interconnection provider) for the costs of any Network Upgrades paid by such Party. Each of Lessor and Lessee shall, at its sole cost and expense, maintain or cause to be maintained in good working order and repair at all times each part of its Project that connects with or which affects the Shared Facilities. Further, each of Lessor and Lessee shall be responsible for all Liabilities arising from such Party’s actions or inactions in violation of this Agreement. 4.2 Shared Expenses; Invoicing; Late Payments. 4.2.1 On and after the CV2 Project COD, each of Lessor and Lessee shall be responsible for and shall make payment to the Manager (in accordance with Section 4.2.2) for Shared Expenses in proportion to its Percentage Interest. For the avoidance of doubt, CV2 shall only be responsible for and shall reimburse the Manager (in accordance with Section 4.2.2) for Shared Expenses that are due and payable after the CV2 Project COD. CV1 shall be solely responsible for all costs and expenses (including taxes) relating to the Shared Facilities prior to the CV2 Project COD. Upon mutual agreement among Lessor and Lessee, the Manager and an Affiliate Service Provider, Lessee may make payments in respect of any Shared Expenses directly to an Affiliate Service Provider on behalf of the Manager. 4.2.2 No later than ten (10) days after the end of each calendar month following the CV2 Project COD, the Manager shall invoice each Party for its respective portion of the Shared Expenses. Manager’s invoice shall include a reasonably detailed description of the Shared Expenses and each Party’s share of the Shared Expenses, along with wire transfer instructions for making payment to Manager. Each of Lessor and Lessee shall make all payments to Manager under this Section 4.2.2 by wire transfer of immediately available funds as provided in the Manager’s invoice, or by an alternative form of payment mutually agreed to by the Parties, within thirty (30) days of receipt of such invoice. All sums not paid within thirty (30) days after receipt of Manager’s invoice shall thereafter bear interest at the Default Rate. Each of Lessor and Lessee shall have the right to audit, and receive supporting documentation for, any expenses or other amounts required to be paid by the other Party under this Agreement. If there is a dispute as to any amount invoiced by Manager, Lessor and Lessee shall pay all amounts not in dispute in accordance with this Section 4.2.2. Lessor and Lessee shall pay any disputed amount ultimately determined as payable with interest thereon at the Default Rate accruing from the date of receipt of the Manager’s disputed invoice. 4.3 Rent. In addition to payment of any Shared Expenses pursuant to Section 4.2, beginning on the CV2 Project COD, Lessee shall be obligated to pay an annual rent to Lessor, which annual rent shall be calculated as set forth in Schedule 2.2 and be due (i) initially on the earlier of (a) the date that the closing of the transfer pursuant to the CV2 Purchase Option occurs, in which case the rent in its prorated amount will be paid together with the Purchase Price, and (b) the first anniversary of the CV2 Project COD; and (ii) if the CV2 Purchase Option has not been exercised, then thereafter and until the CV2 Purchase Option is exercised, on a quarterly basis in arrears on the last Business Day of each of March, June, September and December. Rent payments that are not paid within such time period shall thereafter bear interest at the Default Rate. For the avoidance of doubt, no rent shall be due hereunder by Lessee to Lessor after the CV2 Purchase Option is exercised. 5. USE OF SHARED FACILITIES 5.1 Use. Subject to the other requirements of this Agreement, each of Lessor and Lessee shall have the right to use its Ownership Interest and Lease Interest, respectively, to effectuate interconnection service for its respective Project under the GIA. Neither Lessor nor Lessee shall have the right, at any time and from time to time, to allocate, share or otherwise permit the use by any other Person or Project of all or any portion of such Party’s rights to use the Shared Facilities, unless required to do so by applicable Law. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, the foregoing use rights include use of the capacity of electric transmission lines, transformers, substations, and other electrical components to transmit electricity from such Party’s Project in an amount that may not exceed such Party’s Percentage Interest of such capacity. 5.2 Shared Facilities Representatives. Each of Lessor and Lessee may, by written notice to the other Party and the Manager, designate an individual (the “Shared Facilities Representative”), who will have authority to bind the Lessor or Lessee, as applicable, in all matters concerning this Agreement (other than to amend this Agreement), to communicate with the other Party and the Manager, if applicable, regarding issues relating to this Agreement, including operational and maintenance issues. Each of Lessor and Lessee may change its Shared Facilities Representative at any time and from time to time by prior written notice to the other Party and the Manager. 5.3 Liens. Neither Lessor nor Lessee shall create, permit or suffer to exist by, through or under their respective Representatives, and hereby waives for itself and its Representatives, any Liens on the Shared Facilities, its Ownership Interest or Lease Interest, as applicable, or on Project Specific Assets of the other Party, in each case, other than Permitted Liens. Each of Lessor and Lessee shall take prompt steps to discharge any Lien (other than a Permitted Lien) filed against any Shared Facility, its Ownership Interest or Lease Interest, as applicable, or Project Specific Assets of the other Party. If either Lessor or Lessee is responsible for the imposition of a Lien (other than a Permitted Lien) and fails to discharge promptly any such Lien, the other Party, in addition to any other rights it may have at law or equity for a breach of this Agreement, shall have the right to notify the responsible Party in writing and to take any reasonable action to satisfy, defend, settle or otherwise remove the Lien at the responsible Party’s expense. 6. OBLIGATIONS AND CERTAIN RIGHTS OF LESSOR AND LESSEE 6.1 Standards of Performance. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement to the contrary, each of Lessor and Lessee will operate and/or maintain, or cause to be maintained, its Project, use the Shared Facilities, and perform its obligations under this Agreement, in each case in all material respects, in accordance with (a) all applicable Laws, (b) Prudent Industry Practices, (c) the applicable terms of the GIA, and (d) any and all Governmental Approvals. Except as provided herein, neither Lessor nor Lessee will take any action, omit to take any action or fail to perform any obligation under this Agreement, the GIA, or any Governmental Approvals, as applicable, that materially and adversely affects the other Party or such other Party’s Project or gives rise to a Liability affecting the other Party, such other Party’s Project, or the Shared Facilities, including any action, omission or failure to perform an obligation that results in damage to, disconnection of, or an outage of the other Party’s Project. 6.2 Taxes. Unless otherwise directed by Lessor or Lessee, on and after the Effective Date, the Manager shall pay all taxes levied against the Shared Facilities before delinquency and before any fine, interest or penalty will become due or be imposed for their non-payment, except that the Manager may withhold payment of any tax if the Manager is contesting the payment of such tax in good faith by appropriate proceedings and such proceeding does not involve any danger of the sale, forfeiture or loss of any part of such Shared Facilities, including the posting of any bond that is required by applicable Law to avoid such sale, forfeiture or loss while the payment of such tax is being contested and notifies each of Lessor and Lessee thereof in writing at least thirty (30) days before such payment is due or paid. All such taxes and assessments paid by the Manager shall be treated as Shared Expenses and invoiced to each of Lessor and Lessee in accordance with Section 4.2.2. Each of Lessor and Lessee acknowledges that it shall be liable for its own taxes with respect to the Shared Facilities or any Project Specific Assets. 6.3 Environmental Compliance. Each of Lessor and Lessee shall, with respect to its Project, (including its Project Specific Assets, including the Project Site upon which its Project is installed), be responsible for and shall have exclusive control over all investigations, studies, clean up, corrective action or response or remedial action required by (a) any Governmental Authority now or hereafter authorized to regulate environmental or other matters, or (b) any consent decree or court or administrative order now or hereafter applicable to such Party’s use, operation or ownership of its Project (including its Project Specific Assets and Project Site). The Manager shall, with respect to the Shared Facilities, subject to the oversight and direction of Lessor and Lessee, oversee all investigations, studies, clean-up, corrective action or response or remedial action required by any Governmental Authority now or hereafter authorized to regulate environmental or other matters or by any consent decree or court or administrative order now or hereafter applicable to Lessor’s and Lessee’s use, operation or ownership of the Shared Facilities, and each of Lessor and Lessee shall be responsible, in proportion to its relative Percentage Interest, for all Liabilities related to such investigations, studies, clean up, corrective action or response or remedial action. The Manager shall keep each of Lessor and Lessee fully apprised as to the above matters and shall consult with all of them prior to taking any action involving any Governmental Authority or risk of incurring any Liability, and Lessor and Lessee shall jointly manage and control all investigations and any environmental clean-up, remediation or related activities with respect to such Shared Facilities, or jointly direct Manager to do so. 6.4 Interconnection. 6.4.1 CV2 acknowledges that CV1 intends to use such rights under the GIA as are necessary to interconnect the CV1 Project to the SPP controlled transmission system and to deliver electrical energy generated by the CV1 Project. 6.4.2 CV1 covenants to use commercially reasonable efforts to amend the GIA as soon as reasonably practicable to contemplate the development of the CV2 Project (such amendment, the “GIA Amendment”). The GIA Amendment will, among other things, (i) continue to permit CV1 to expand its use rights under the GIA to interconnect the CV2 Project to the SPP controlled transmission system and to deliver electrical energy generated by the CV2 Project, (ii) include an acknowledgment that the CV1 Project and the CV2 Project are separate projects owned by separate project companies, (iii) add CV2 as a notice party under the GIA, and (iv) grant CV2 the ability to cure CV1 defaults under the GIA, and will otherwise be in form and substance reasonably satisfactory to CV1 and CV2. Each of CV1 and CV2 acknowledge that the GIA Amendment may need to be filed with FERC as a non-conforming generator interconnection agreement. 6.4.3 In the event that CV2 seeks to obtain a stand-alone generator interconnection agreement, CV1 covenants that, upon request by CV2, it will use commercially reasonable efforts to amend the GIA as soon as reasonably practicable to accommodate such stand-alone generator interconnection agreement, including (if requested by CV2) by relinquishing its rights to 64.8 MW of Energy Resource Interconnection Service under (and as defined in) the GIA; provided that, for the avoidance of doubt, CV1 shall not be required to amend the GIA in a manner that would have an adverse effect on the rights that CV1 requires to operate the CV1 Project. In the event that CV2 obtains a stand-alone generator interconnection agreement, each of the Parties and Enel will work in good faith to amend this Agreement to reflect that CV2 has obtained such stand-alone generator interconnection agreement and CV2 will reimburse CV1 for all of CV1’s reasonable out of pocket expenses associated with such amendment. 6.4.4 In the event CV2 does not obtain a stand-alone generator interconnection agreement and upon request by CV2, each of CV1 and CV2 covenants that it will work in good faith to implement the Transco Structure and amend this Agreement to reflect the Transco Structure. CV1 and CV2 shall cooperate and use commercially reasonable efforts to obtain all third party approvals and Governmental Approvals (including, without limitation, any approvals from FERC and SPP) required for the implementation of the Transco Structure, including filing a statement with FERC committing Transco to comply with and be bound by all obligations and procedures applicable to electric utilities under Section 210 of the Federal Power Act. Furthermore, CV2 agrees to reimburse CV1 for of CV1’s reasonable out of pocket expenses associated with the implementation of the Transco Structure. 6.4.5 CV1 covenants to perform all of its obligations under the GIA for the benefit of CV1 and CV2 until such time as CV2 obtains a stand-alone generator interconnection agreement or the GIA is assigned to Transco. 6.4.6 Lessor and Lessee may take such actions as may be necessary to comply with any order received from a balancing authority or Governmental Authority, and nothing herein shall require Lessor or Lessee to violate the requirements of any such order. 6.5 Voting or Approval Rights. Approval of the Required Consent shall be required for any approval in respect of any Major Decision; provided, however, that during the occurrence and continuance of an Event of Default by Lessor or Lessee, the voting and approval rights of the defaulting Party shall be suspended except with respect to Major Decisions. 6.6 Relationship of Lessor and Lessee. The rights, duties, obligations and liabilities of the Parties under this Agreement with respect to each other will be individual and not joint or collective, and neither Party shall be responsible for the default of the other Party under this Agreement. It is not the intention of the Parties to create, nor will this Agreement be deemed to create, any partnership (for federal income tax purposes or otherwise), agency, joint venture or trust, or to authorize either Party to act as an agent, servant or employee for the other Party. Each Party will remain solely responsible for the actions of its own employees. 6.7 Regulatory Status. 6.7.1 Each of Lessor and Lessee shall use commercially reasonable efforts to obtain, prior to any production, sale or delivery of energy, capacity or ancillary services from its Project, including test energy, and thereafter maintain, status as an EWG for so long as it is a party to this Agreement or has any interest in the Shared Facilities. Neither Lessor nor Lessee shall take any action that could adversely impact the other Party’s ability to qualify as an EWG. 6.7.2 The Parties shall cooperate and use commercially reasonable efforts to obtain to the extent required by applicable Law, (a) final orders from FERC authorizing the grant of the Lease Interest in the Shared Facilities as contemplated by this Agreement, and (b) a final order from FERC accepting for filing this Agreement, or any amendments thereto, under Section 205 of the Federal Power Act, and granting waivers from the standards of conduct and from maintaining an open access transmission tariff and an open access same-time information system. The Parties shall negotiate in good faith any amendments or revisions to this Agreement as may be necessary to obtain such final orders from FERC. 6.8 No Dedication of Property; No Public Access. Each Party agrees that entering into this Agreement, performing its obligations hereunder, or exercising its rights hereunder, either in whole or part, is not intended to be, and shall in no way be construed as or deemed to be a dedication to public or quasi-public use or purpose of any of the Project Specific Assets of the Party, the Project Specific Assets of another Party, any Shared Facilities, or any portion of the foregoing. Lessor and Lessee shall undertake to cooperate in enforcing such requirement for limiting physical access to the Shared Facilities, including permitting the Manager to establish and enforce procedures and protocol for security, safety, and protection of the Shared Facilities. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Parties shall comply with requirements set forth in any Governmental Approvals. 6.9 Co-Location Rights. Each of Lessor and Lessee shall be permitted to encroach upon the Shared Facilities with its Project Specific Assets (including collection lines) solely to the extent necessary to develop, construct, operate and/or maintain its Project, provided that any such encroachments or overhang shall be subject to the noninterference protections of Section 3.4 above. In particular, Lessor’s or Lessee’s exercise of rights under this Section shall only be permitted in accordance with Prudent Industry Practices, and shall not interfere with or endanger the construction, operation, or maintenance of the transmission lines, substations, or operations and maintenance facilities components of the Shared Facilities. In the event of a conflict in the location or operation of the Shared Facilities and any Project Specific Assets, the Shared Facilities shall take priority over the Project Specific Assets. 6.10 Cooperation in Financing. Upon reasonable request of a Party, the other Party shall cooperate in the financing or refinancing of such requesting Party or Party’s Project, including the execution of estoppels, consents for the benefit of the Financing Parties and other similar agreements as may be reasonably requested by the requesting Party and its Financing Parties, in the making of any filings required by such requesting Party for regulatory compliance or obtaining Governmental Approvals, and in the operation and maintenance of such requesting Party’s Project, all solely at the expense of the requesting Party. 6.11 Lessor’s and Lessee’s Responsibilities to Manager. Each of Lessor and Lessee shall do all of the following: (a) with the exception of information and data the Manager is required to record and collect hereunder, provide the Manager with all material information, including information related to Governmental Approvals, agreements, data and documents for the Shared Facilities that is reasonably required for Manager to perform its obligations under this Agreement; (b) promptly examine all material documents submitted by Manager and render any necessary decisions pertaining thereto; (c) promptly make material decisions required under this Agreement or any other agreement that the Manager may be requested to administer hereunder and respond to all reasonable requests from Manager for approval made hereunder; (d) promptly execute and deliver such evidence of Manager’s authority hereunder as may be reasonably required by third parties; (e) except where the same are being disputed in good faith, promptly make all payments and incur all expenditures required in connection with the Shared Facilities in accordance with this Agreement; and (f) consult with the other Party (and the Manager) in real time to ensure that Lessor and Lessee do not collectively exceed instructed delivery under the GIA. 6.12 Outage, Curtailment or Disconnection. To the extent Lessor’s or Lessee’s operating Project is disconnected, incurs any downtime, is curtailed or an outage occurs, in each case, resulting in a loss of production and revenue to such Project, and the loss arises from another Party’s actions or inactions, then, in any such case, the responsible Party shall reimburse the other Party for such lost production and revenue (including Lost PTC Value) within thirty (30) days of notice and supporting documentation of the loss. [Reserved]. 6.14 Withdrawal by Lessor or Lessee. 6.14.1 At its election in its sole discretion, Lessor or Lessee may cease to participate in the use of the Shared Facilities under this Agreement by delivery of a written notice (a “Withdrawal Notice”) to the other Party and the Manager in which the withdrawing Party certifies, as of the date specified in the Withdrawal Notice (a “Withdrawal Date”) that it has obtained FERC approval (if applicable) (i) in connection with the grant, sale, transfer, assignment and conveyance of the Ownership Interest in the Shared Facilities to Lessee if the withdrawing Party is Lessor and (ii) in connection with the termination of the Lease Interest in the Shared Facilities if the withdrawing Party is Lessee, in each case as contemplated in Section 6.14.2. The withdrawing Party shall provide at least thirty (30) days advance written notice to the other Party and the Manager of its intention to no longer participate in the use of the Shared Facilities under this Agreement. 6.14.2 Effective upon the Withdrawal Date and upon and subject to the terms, conditions, restrictions and reservations set forth in this Agreement, the Party for which the Withdrawal Date applies shall be deemed to have, (i) if Lessor is the withdrawing Party, transferred to Lessee its Ownership Interest in and to the Shared Facilities, AS IS, WITH ALL FAULTS AND WITHOUT ANY REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES WHATSOEVER, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, AND SPECIFICALLY EXCLUDING ANY WARRANTY OF TITLE, MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR ANY OTHER WARRANTY ARISING UNDER STATUTORY OR COMMON LAW, and (ii) if Lessee is the withdrawing Party, terminated the Lease Interest, in each case without additional compensation. The intent of the foregoing is the remaining Party shall own all undivided interests in the Shared Facilities. 6.14.3 Effective upon the Withdrawal Date, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the Party for which the Withdrawal Date applies shall either release, assign or terminate its rights in the Shared Facilities, as may be requested by the other Party in writing; provided, however, that such release, assignment or termination does not materially and adversely affect the other Party’s Project or the Shared Facilities. 6.14.4 After its Withdrawal Date, the Party for which the Withdrawal Notice applies shall remain a party to this Agreement but shall have no rights or obligations under this Agreement except those set forth in Section 4.1, Section 4.2 (in each case, relating to the payment of its Percentage Interest (prior to the Withdrawal Date) of (x) Shared Expenses incurred prior to the Withdrawal Date and (y) Removal Costs, as reasonably projected by the Manager), Section 4.3 (relating to rent payments accrued but unpaid as of the Withdrawal Date), Section 5.3, Article 11 and Article 13. 6.15 Metering Protocol; Backfeed Power. 6.15.1 The metering protocol ensuring the accurate recordation and allocation of output between the Projects (including reflecting line losses and no-load losses) and otherwise giving effect to each of Lessor’s and Lessee’s rights and obligations in using the Shared Facilities under this Agreement are attached hereto as Schedule 6.15 (the “Metering Protocol”). As a condition to the Parties’ agreement to adoption of the Metering Protocol, Enel has provided to the Parties evidence that the purchasers of the output of CV1 and CV2 under the CV1 PPA and CV2 PPA, respectively, have approved the metering protocol. 6.15.2 Backfeed power delivered through the Shared Facilities shall be split and paid for proportionally between the Lessor and Lessee as follows: (a) The Lessor shall receive an amount of backfeed power equal to the product of (x) the total amount of backfeed power delivered through the Shared Facilities multiplied by (y) a fraction, the numerator of which is equal to the total number of wind turbine generators at the Lessor’s Project that are offline at such time and the denominator of which is total number of wind turbine generators at both Projects that are offline at such time. (b) The Lessee shall receive an amount of backfeed power equal to the product of (x) the total amount of backfeed power delivered through the Shared Facilities multiplied by (y) a fraction, the numerator of which is equal to the total number of wind turbine generators at the Lessee’s Project that are offline at such time and the denominator of which is total number of wind turbine generators at both Projects that are offline at such time. 7. APPOINTMENT OF MANAGER 7.1 Engagement of the Manager. The manager shall manage, operate, and maintain the Shared Facilities and perform other duties pertaining to the Shared Facilities, all as set forth in this Agreement (the “Manager”). The initial Manager shall be CV1. The Manager accepts such engagement and agrees to perform such duties in accordance with the terms and conditions hereof. The Manager shall hold such position until it resigns or is removed or replaced as provided by this Section 7. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in the foregoing, if pursuant to any provision under this Agreement, Manager is precluded from performing any service, Manager shall be relieved from its obligation to provide such service. 7.2 Relationship. Except as otherwise set forth herein (a) neither the Manager nor any of its Affiliates, employees, subcontractors, vendors or suppliers, nor any employees of any of the foregoing Persons, shall be deemed to be agents, representatives, employees, or servants of Lessor or Lessee as a result of this Agreement or of performing any duties hereunder, and (b) no such Person as a result of entering into this Agreement or of performing any duties hereunder shall have the right, authority, obligation or duty to assume, create or incur any liability or obligation, express or implied, against, in the name of, or on behalf of Lessor or Lessee. In no case shall this Agreement be construed to create a relationship of partnership or any other association of profit between Lessor and Lessee, on the one hand, and the Manager or any of its Affiliates, employees, subcontractors, vendors or suppliers, or any employees of any of the foregoing Persons, on the other hand. 7.3 Removal of the Manager. The Manager may be removed with the approval of the Required Consent if (a) Manager (i) breaches any material provision of this Agreement in such a way that has a material adverse effect on the operation or maintenance of the Shared Facilities, or (ii) engages in gross negligence or willful misconduct in the performance of its obligations hereunder, and (b) Manager fails to cure any such breach or action within thirty (30) days after receiving notice thereof from either Lessor or Lessee (or, if such cure cannot reasonably be completed within the thirty (30) day period, Manager fails to undertake and promptly cure upon receipt of such notice or fails to give adequate assurances to Lessor and Lessee that such breach or action will be so cured with all reasonable speed). The Manager may not participate in, and any voting interest associated with any Percentage Interests in the Shared Facilities in which the Manager has a possessory interest (through ownership or otherwise) shall be excluded from, any decision to remove or replace a Manager under this Section 7.3. 7.4 Resignation of the Manager. Manager may resign from its position as Manager if any of the following occur: (a) failure by Lessor or Lessee to make undisputed payments when such payments are due and payable under this Agreement, unless within 60 days after written notice from Manager to the Lessor and Lessee of such non-payment, all such undisputed payments are made to Manager in accordance herewith; (b) both Lessor and Lessee dissolve, liquidate, or terminate their corporate existence; or (c) the Manager provides 120 days’ written notice to each of Lessor and Lessee of its intention to resign as Manager hereunder. 7.5 Obligations at End of Term or Upon Removal or Resignation. The Manager shall perform all services with respect to the Shared Facilities as required under this Agreement through the date of termination or expiration of this Agreement or the removal or resignation of the Manager in accordance with this Article 7, and each of Lessor and Lessee shall make all payments required by it hereunder through such date, with such payment to be made in full within 30 days after such termination, expiration, removal or resignation. No removal or resignation of the Manager in accordance with this Article 7 shall be effective unless and until a successor Manager is appointed with the approval of the Required Consent; provided that if the Manager was removed for cause pursuant to Section 7.3, such Manager may not participate in, and any voting interest associated with any Percentage Interests in the Shared Facilities in which the Manager has a possessory interest (through ownership or otherwise) shall be excluded from, any decision to appoint a replacement Manager under this Section 7.5. In the event of any removal or resignation of the Manager in accordance with this Article 7, the Manager shall provide reasonable assistance to Lessor and Lessee to assure a smooth, efficient transition of its services to a replacement Manager, for which Manager shall be reimbursed its reasonable expenses in connection therewith. 7.6 Immunities. The Manager and its respective directors, officers, employees or agents shall not be responsible for any action taken or omitted to be taken by it or them under this Agreement or in connection herewith, except for its or their own gross negligence or willful misconduct as determined by a final non-appealable judgment of a court of competent jurisdiction. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, the Manager may consult with legal counsel, independent public accountants and other experts selected by it and shall not be liable for any action taken or omitted to be taken in good faith by them in accordance with the advice of such counsel, accountants or experts. 7.7 Non-Reliance. Each of Lessor and Lessee represents, as of the Effective Date, that it has reviewed the terms of such documents and information that it has deemed appropriate, and that it has made its own appraisal in respect of the Shared Facilities, in each case, independently and without reliance on the Manager. Each of Lessor and Lessee shall review the terms of such other documents and information that at the time it may deem appropriate, and it shall continue to make its own appraisal in respect of the Shared Facilities, or in respect of any other matter for which such Party may be entitled to vote or give consent under this Agreement, in any such case, independently and without reliance on the Manager. 7.8 Successor Manager. In the event that a successor Manager appointed by the Required Consent is not also a Lessor or Lessee under this agreement, then Lessor and Lessee and successor Manager shall negotiate in good faith any amendments or revisions to this Agreement as may be reasonably requested by Lessor or Lessee. 8. DUTIES OF THE MANAGER 8.1 In General. The Manager, at the direction of Lessor and Lessee as specified in this Agreement, at all times shall do the following: (a) cause the Shared Facilities to be designed, constructed, operated, and maintained pursuant to the GIA, the Build-Out Agreement, Prudent Industry Practices, and any applicable Laws and Governmental Approvals; (b) take any and all action as may be reasonably necessary to enforce and preserve warranty claims or other claims related to the Shared Facilities; (c) oversee all investigations, studies, clean up, corrective action or response or remedial action required by any Governmental Authority applicable to Lessor’s and Lessee’s use, operation or ownership of the Shared Facilities and keep Lessor and Lessee fully apprised as to the foregoing matters affecting the Shared Facilities; (d) subject to any rights of CV2 under the GIA, act as the single point of contact for communications between Lessor and Lessee, on one hand, and SPP, on the other hand, related to the Shared Facilities (including curtailment orders affecting the Projects); (e) perform all regulatory reporting, auditing and other related matters (including with respect to any obligations imposed by NERC or FERC on the Shared Facilities) arising out of, or in connection with, the Shared Facilities; (f) share with Lessor and Lessee the data necessary for implementing the Metering Protocol; (g) obtain and maintain all Governmental Approvals necessary to construct, operate, and maintain the Shared Facilities; and (h) take such other actions as are reasonably necessary to effectuate the foregoing, unless in any such case, such action is not in the commercially reasonable interest of Lessor and Lessee. 8.2 Specific Authority. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, the Manager may take any of the following actions without further approval from Lessor and Lessee: 8.2.1 interface with the CV1 Manager and the BOP Operator, as applicable, with respect to day-to-day management, operations and maintenance of the Shared Facilities; 8.2.2 negotiate, enter into, execute, acknowledge or amend agreements relating to the management, use, operation, maintenance, and repair of the Shared Facilities, in each case in accordance with the then-effective Annual Shared Facilities Budget; provided, however, that (a) no such actions adversely (and, after either of (i) the execution of a stand-alone generator interconnection agreement pursuant to Section 6.4.3 or (ii) the implementation of the Transco Structure pursuant to Section 6.4.4, materially) affect the rights or privileges of Lessor or Lessee or their respective use, operation, access to or availability of the Shared Facilities, and (b) the Manager shall provide Lessor and Lessee with copies of any such agreement promptly upon execution thereof; 8.2.3 to pay and collect amounts due in connection with the Shared Facilities, and to maintain one or more bank accounts wherein funds received by the Manager in connection with its duties hereunder shall be maintained, in each case in accordance with the then-effective Annual Shared Facilities Budget; 8.2.4 procure insurance policies pursuant to Article 12; and 8.2.5 to execute, acknowledge, and deliver any and all instruments and take such other steps as are reasonably necessary to effectuate the foregoing and as are consistent therewith. 8.3 Limitation on Authority. The Manager shall not, without the approval of the Required Consent: (a) create or cause to be created any Lien (other than Permitted Liens) on any of the Shared Facilities or the GIA; (b) take any action that would prevent the development, construction or operation of, otherwise result in a material impairment of, the CV1 Project, CV2 Project or the Shared Facilities; (c) perform or omit to perform any act which would cause any person reasonably to believe that the Manager is a partner of Lessor or Lessee or authorized to bind Lessor or Lessee, except as expressly authorized herein; (d) sell, assign, mortgage, encumber, convey or otherwise transfer all or any portion of the Ownership Interest or Lease Interest, or any components of the Shared Facilities (other than pursuant to this Agreement); (e) borrow funds or otherwise incur indebtedness on behalf of Lessor or Lessee; or (f) take any action that constitutes a Major Decision hereunder. 8.4 Reporting; Notices; Records. The Manager shall, from time to time, provide reports to Lessor and Lessee sufficient to keep Lessor and Lessee reasonably apprised as to significant matters concerning the maintenance and repair of the Shared Facilities, including such matters related thereto as may have a material impact on the operation, maintenance and repair of Lessor’s and Lessee’s respective Projects. The Manager’s reporting obligations shall include all of the following: (a) to the extent requested by Lessor or Lessee, provide data and information regarding the Shared Facilities’ performance and availability; (b) providing to Lessor and Lessee written notice of any communications, orders or requirements of any Governmental Authority affecting the Shared Facilities; (c) collecting and providing any information, to the extent such information is in Manager’s possession or is reasonably available to Manager, regarding the Shared Facilities required for any reports to, or filings with, any Governmental Authorities; (d) reporting promptly (and in any event within 24 hours of becoming aware of an incident) to Lessor and Lessee and to any other Persons entitled to receive such notice any incident of Emergency on the Shared Facilities or otherwise adversely affecting any of the Shared Facilities, of which it becomes aware; (e) providing such other reports and information as may be reasonably requested by Lessor or Lessee under the terms of this Agreement. 8.5 Audit Rights. The Manager shall allow Lessor and Lessee and their respective authorized Representatives to inspect and audit the books and records maintained by the Manager with respect to the Shared Facilities (at Lessor’s and Lessee’s sole cost and expense); provided, however, that Lessor and Lessee shall only have the right to inspect and audit such books and records for any period that is within two calendar years from the date of an applicable payment is made hereunder or the final settlement or disposition of any claim made pursuant to this Agreement. If any such inspection or audit discloses an error and that, as a result thereof, any overpayment or any underpayment has occurred hereunder, the amount thereof shall be paid within thirty (30) days after receipt of an invoice (with reasonable supporting detail) with interest at the Default Rate (except that any underpayment caused by the actions or inactions of Manager will not bear interest) to the Party to whom it is owed by the other Party obligated therefor; provided, further, that a Party shall only be liable for any amounts hereunder that relate to errors discovered and disclosed within the inspection and audit period provided for in this provision. 8.6 Annual Budget. On or before September 30th of each year, the Manager shall provide Lessor and Lessee with a draft of the annual budget (an “Annual Shared Facilities Budget”) related to the Shared Facilities. Lessor and Lessee may submit any comments or questions to the Manager within thirty (30) days of receipt of the draft Annual Shared Facilities Budget. The Manager shall incorporate any comments received and shall provide a final Annual Shared Facilities Budget to Lessor and Lessee by November 30th of each year for approval by the Required Consent. To the extent that the final Annual Shared Facilities Budget is not approved by the Required Consent within fifteen Business Days after receipt by the Lessor and Lessee, an amount designated by the Manager not to exceed 110% of the corresponding amounts for such items in the most recent Annual Shared Facilities Budget that has been so approved by the Required Consent (excluding extraordinary items therein) will continue as part of the budget for such year until a more current amount for such item is approved under this Section 8.6; provided that to the extent not agreed by the Required Consent, amounts included in a proposed budget (including, if applicable, in respect of insurance) may not exceed 110% of the corresponding amounts for such items in the most recent Annual Shared Facilities Budget that has been so approved by the Required Consent if such amounts (x) are for payments, fees or charges to be paid by the Lessor or Lessee to the Manager or an Affiliate of the Manager and (y) are not otherwise subject to Lessor and Lessee approval during the course of the calendar year as a Major Decision. The Shared Facilities Budget may be amended during the year by the Required Consent. 8.7 Emergencies. In the event of any Emergency involving the Shared Facilities, the Manager shall take such action as may be reasonable and necessary to prevent, avoid or mitigate injury, loss of life, or damage or destruction of property and shall, as soon as reasonably practicable, report any such Emergency, including the Manager’s response thereto, to Lessor and Lessee. 8.8 Cooperation with SPP and OGE. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, the Manager shall cooperate with SPP and OGE (and any successor agency or other entities having authority over the Shared Facilities) to make all such information, reports, logs and other documents relating to the Shared Facilities available to SPP and OGE as may be required pursuant to the terms and conditions of the GIA (or other agreements providing interconnection service to the Projects) and SPP’s open access transmission tariff. 8.9 Obligations. The Manager shall have no liability for any obligations except those expressly stated in this Agreement, and nothing in this Agreement shall obligate the Manager to perform any duties or assume any liabilities under any agreement to which the Manager is not directly a party unless such duties are also expressly stated in this Agreement and then only to such extent. Lessor and Lessee acknowledge that the Manager’s performance under this Agreement is dependent upon the Manager having access to all parts of the Shared Facilities and access to all documents as reasonably required by the Manager, and having required approvals and decisions from Lessor and Lessee. 8.10 Inspection by Lessor and Lessee. The Manager shall permit Lessor and Lessee to inspect the Shared Facilities during regular business hours, provided that Lessor and Lessee, as applicable, arrange any such inspection with Manager and complies with the safety requirements imposed by Manager. The Manager at all times will retain responsibility for the services that meet the requirements of this Agreement, regardless of whether or not Lessor and Lessee have reviewed or inspected such services, plans, documentation or other acts or items. 8.11 Risk of Loss; Loss Events 8.11.1 Risk of Loss. As between Lessor and Lessee, on the one hand, and Manager, on the other hand, Lessor and Lessee (in proportion to their respective Percentage Interests) shall be responsible for the risk of loss to the Shared Facilities or any portion thereof during the term of this Agreement. 8.11.2 Loss Events. Upon the occurrence of a Loss Event, the Manager shall, as soon as reasonably practicable, prepare a written proposal (a “Restoration Proposal”) in consultation with Lessor and Lessee to rebuild, repair, restore or replace the portion of the Shared Facilities affected by such Loss Event, which Restoration Proposal shall contain, in appropriate detail, (a) a budget identifying all categories and approximate amounts reasonably anticipated to be incurred, (b) a progress and completion schedule and (c) a written plan, in each case, for the proposed rebuilding, repair, restoration or replacement of the Shared Facilities. The Manager, to the extent necessary or prudent, may coordinate preparation of the Restoration Proposal with similar activity undertaken by or on behalf of Lessor or Lessee arising out of the Loss Event in respect of Project Specific Assets. Any costs, expenses or other Liabilities associated with the preparation of the Restoration Proposal shall be Shared Expenses reimbursed by each Party in proportion to its respective Percentage Interest as of the date of the Loss Event. Within 30 days after receipt of a Restoration Proposal from the Manager, Lessor and Lessee shall notify the Manager and the other Party in writing of whether it elects to participate in the rebuilding, repair, restoration or replacement of the Shared Facilities. Any costs, expenses or other Liabilities associated with the rebuilding, repair, restoration or replacement of the portion of the Shared Facilities affected by a Loss Event shall be Shared Expenses that are reimbursed by each Party that has elected to participate in such activity, in proportion to its respective Percentage Interest. If a Party fails to provide notice of its election within the thirty (30) day period specified above, such Party shall be deemed to have given a Withdrawal Notice as of the earlier of (i) the date of its election or (ii) the end of such 30 day period. If a Party elects not to participate, the participating Party shall have the right to require the non-participating Party to withdraw from the Shared Facilities. Any disputes regarding the Restoration Proposal (including (x) the costs and budget associated with any such rebuilding, repair, restoration or replacement of the Shared Facilities, (y) the schedule for such rebuilding, repair, restoration or replacement of the Shared Facilities and (z) the written plan for such rebuilding, repair, restoration or replacement of the Shared Facilities) shall be subject to the dispute resolution procedures set forth in Article 15 and Exhibit D. 8.12 Manager Representative.
