The Manager may, by written notice to Lessor and Lessee, designate an individual representative (the “Manager Representative”) whose instructions, requests, and decisions will be binding upon such Manager in all matters concerning this Agreement, except that the Manager Representative shall not have the authority to amend this Agreement. The Manager shall have the right to change the Manager Representative at any time and from time to time by written notice to Lessor and Lessee. 8.13 Standards of Performance. Throughout the term of this Agreement, the Manager shall perform the services and all other obligations under this Agreement and in accordance with Prudent Industry Practices, the GIA, and all applicable Laws and Governmental Approvals. 8.14 Assignment of Warranties. The Manager shall be responsible for enforcing all manufacturer, constructor and other warranties with respect to the Shared Facilities and any parts or materials associated therewith on behalf of Lessor and Lessee. Lessor, Lessee and the Manager shall cooperate in the enforcement of the foregoing warranties, and to the extent possible, any Party that is not also the Manager holding a warranty for a portion of the Shared Facilities shall assign such warranty to Manager for enforcement and collection, and any funds received in lieu of repair or replacement shall be used for repair or replacement of the affected Shared Facilities. Any excess warranty funds shall be distributed to Lessor and Lessee in proportion to their Percentage Interest. The Manager’s documented out of pocket costs and expenses incurred in enforcing said warranties shall be included in the Shared Expenses hereunder. 9. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES 9.1 Representations and Warranties. As of the date of this Agreement, each Party (and in the case of CV2, each of the Enel Parties) represents and warrants to the other Party that: it is duly organized, validly existing and in good standing under the Laws of the jurisdiction of formation; (b) it has the power to execute and deliver this Agreement and to perform its obligations under this Agreement and has taken all necessary limited liability company actions to authorize such execution and delivery and performance of such obligations; (c) its execution and delivery of this Agreement and its performance of its obligations under this Agreement do not violate or conflict with any Law applicable to it; with any provision of its certificate of formation or limited liability company agreement; with any order or judgment of any court or other agency of government applicable to it or any of its assets; or with any contractual restriction binding on or affecting it or any of its assets; and (d) this Agreement constitutes the Party’s and Enel’s legal, valid, and binding obligation, enforceable against it in accordance with its terms (subject to applicable bankruptcy, reorganization, insolvency, moratorium or similar Laws affecting creditors’ rights generally and subject, as to enforceability, to equitable principles of general application, regardless of whether enforcement is sought in a proceeding in equity or at law). 9.2 Exclusivity of Warranties. THE REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES PROVIDED IN THIS AGREEMENT ARE EXCLUSIVE, AND NO OTHER WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, WHETHER STATUTORY, EXPRESS, OR IMPLIED (INCLUDING ALL WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE) WILL APPLY TO THE SUBJECT MATTER OF THIS AGREEMENT. 10. FORCE MAJEURE Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, each Party’s obligations under this Agreement shall be suspended by any Force Majeure if and to the extent that such Party is prevented or delayed from performing by reason of the Force Majeure; provided, however, that (a) the prevention or delay of performance shall be of no greater scope and of no longer duration than is necessarily caused by the Force Majeure and required by any remedial measures, (b) no obligations of any Party that arose before the occurrence of such causes shall be excused as the result of the occurrence, and (c) each Party shall use reasonable commercial efforts to remedy its inability to perform; provided, further, that no Force Majeure shall excuse any payment obligations due hereunder. If the performance by any Party of its obligations under this Agreement is affected by any Force Majeure, such Party shall as soon as practicable notify the other Parties of the nature and extent thereof. 11. INDEMNIFICATION 11.1 Party Indemnification. To the fullest extent permitted by Law, each Party agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless each other Party, the Manager (if applicable) and the other Party’s and Manager’s directors, managers, officers, shareholders, partners, members, Affiliates (other than the indemnifying Party), employees, agents, representatives, successors and assigns (collectively, the “Indemnified Parties”), from and against any and all Liabilities to the extent arising out of or related to (a) any breach of this Agreement or the GIA by the indemnifying Party, (b) willful misconduct of the indemnifying Party, (c) any grossly negligent act or omission of the indemnifying Party, (d) any violation of or noncompliance with applicable Laws or Governmental Approvals, or (e) any Hazardous Substances spilled, generated, released or introduced into or on the real property on which the Shared Facilities are located or a Project Site by, through or on behalf of the indemnifying Party. The indemnification provided under this Section 11.1 will not apply to the extent any Liability is caused by the gross negligence, willful misconduct or intentionally wrongful acts or omissions of any of the applicable Indemnified Parties. For purposes of this Article 11, the Enel Parties shall be jointly and severally considered to be a Party with respect to all obligations of CV2 as a Party, including obligations as an indemnifying Party. In the case of Enel, upon making any indemnity payment under this Section 11.1, Enel will, to the extent of such indemnity payment, be subrogated to all rights of the applicable Indemnified Parties against CV2. 11.2 Notice and Legal Defense. Promptly after receipt by an Indemnified Party under this Article 11 or other parts of this Agreement of any claim or notice or the commencement of any action, administrative or legal proceeding, or investigation as to which indemnity provided for in this Article 11 may apply, the applicable Indemnified Party will notify the indemnifying Party hereunder in writing of such fact. The indemnifying Party hereunder will assume the defense thereof with counsel designated by the applicable indemnifying Party and reasonably satisfactory to the Indemnified Party; provided, however, that if the defendants in any such action include both the indemnifying Party and the applicable Indemnified Party, and the Indemnified Party will have reasonably concluded that there may be legal defenses available to it which are different from or additional to, or inconsistent with, those available to the applicable indemnifying Party, the Indemnified Party will have the right to select separate counsel to participate in the defense of such action on behalf of the Indemnified Party, at the applicable indemnifying Party’s reasonable expense. The applicable indemnifying Party will not, without the written consent of the Indemnified Party, (a) settle or compromise any indemnity claim or consent to the entry of any final judgment that does not include as an unconditional term thereof the delivery by the claimant or plaintiff of a written release or releases from all liability in respect of such indemnity claim of all Indemnified Parties affected by such indemnity claim, or (b) settle or compromise any indemnity claim if the settlement imposes equitable remedies or material obligations on the Indemnified Party other than financial obligations for which such Indemnified Party will be indemnified under this Agreement. 11.3 Failure to Defend Action. Should the Indemnified Party be entitled to indemnification under this Article 11 as a result of a claim by a third party, and the indemnifying Party fails to assume the defense of such claim, the Indemnified Party may, at the expense of the indemnifying Party, contest (or, with the prior written consent of the indemnifying Party, settle) such claim. 11.4 Indemnification Amount. In the event that an indemnifying Party is obligated to indemnify and hold an Indemnified Party harmless under this Article 11, the amount owing to the Indemnified Party will be the amount of such Indemnified Party’s reasonable, documented actual out-of-pocket loss net of any insurance or other recovery. 11.5 Supremacy and Survival. The provisions expressed in this Article 11 will prevail over any conflicting or inconsistent provisions contained elsewhere in this Agreement and will survive termination of this Agreement. This Article 11 shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement until the expiration of the applicable statute of limitations. 12. INSURANCE 12.1 Insurance Requirements. On and after the Effective Date, (a) each of Lessor and Lessee, at its sole cost, shall procure and thereafter maintain in effect at all times thereafter, insurance policies and coverages described in Exhibit C, or (b) upon the agreement of Lessor and Lessee, either Lessor, Lessee or the Manager shall procure such insurance on behalf of both of Lessor and Lessee. Lessor and Lessee shall bear responsibility for any premiums for insurance policies procured and maintained by another Party or the Manager based on their respective Percentage Interest. 12.2 Evidence, Terms and Modification of Insurance. 12.2.1 Upon request, the applicable Party shall provide to any other Party insurance certificates reasonably acceptable to the requesting Party evidencing that insurance coverages are in compliance with this Agreement. Such insurance and certificates shall (a) name the other Party and the Manager as an additional insured on a primary/non contributory basis under the Worker’s Compensation, Comprehensive General Liability, Comprehensive Auto Liability, Employer’s Liability, and Umbrella Liability policies to the extent of their respective interests; and (b) provide a waiver of any rights of subrogation against the other Party and the Manager. All policies of a Party shall be written with insurers that such Party, in its reasonable discretion, deems acceptable (such acceptance will not be unreasonably withheld or delayed). All policies shall be written on an occurrence basis. All policies shall contain an endorsement that the other Party’s insurance policies shall be primary in all instances regardless of like coverages, if any, carried by such other Party. No Party’s liability under this Agreement is limited to the amount of insurance coverage required herein by virtue of this Section 12.2. 12.2.2 If any insurance required to be maintained by a Party hereunder ceases to be available on commercially reasonable terms in the commercial insurance market, such Party shall provide written notice to the other Parties, accompanied by a certificate from an independent insurance advisor of recognized national standing, certifying that such insurance is not available on commercially reasonable terms in the commercial insurance market for electric generating plants of similar type, geographic location and design. Upon receipt of such notice, such first-mentioned Party shall use commercially reasonable efforts to obtain other insurance that would provide comparable protection against the risk to be insured, and the other Party shall not unreasonably withhold its consent to modify or waive such requirement. 13. CONFIDENTIALITY 13.1 The Confidential Information shall not be disclosed or permitted to be disclosed by the Receiving Party to any other person or entity not a Party hereto without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party, except: (a) to the Receiving Party’s Representatives; provided, however, that the Receiving Party informs its Representatives of the confidential nature of the Confidential Information; and (b) to the extent such information is required to be disclosed under applicable Law or stock exchange regulations or by a governmental or court order, decree, regulation or rule; provided, however, that the Receiving Party uses commercially reasonable efforts to give prompt written notice to the Disclosing Party in advance of such disclosure to permit the Disclosing Party to obtain a protective order against or otherwise to limit the disclosure (in connection with which the Receiving Party shall reasonably cooperate with the Disclosing Party); provided, further, that, in any case, the Receiving Party shall only disclose that portion of the Confidential Information that, in the opinion of the Receiving Party’s legal counsel, is required to be disclosed and shall use its commercially reasonable efforts to ensure further confidential treatment of the Confidential Information so disclosed. 13.2 The Receiving Party shall use the Confidential Information, or permit the same to be used by the Receiving Party’s Representatives, in connection with the Receiving Party’s exercise of its rights and performance of its obligations under this Agreement and for no other purpose whatsoever. 13.3 The Parties acknowledge that the Disclosing Party would not have an adequate remedy at law for money damages for a breach of the covenants contained in this Article 13. Accordingly, the Disclosing Party shall be entitled to seek an injunction restraining such disclosure and other equitable relief (including specific performance), without the requirement of posting a bond or other security. 13.4 Confidential Information will remain the property of Disclosing Party. Written Confidential Information, and any copies thereof, shall be returned to Disclosing Party or destroyed immediately upon its written request, and no copies will be retained by Receiving Party or its Representatives, unless the Disclosing Party otherwise expressly agrees or as may be required under applicable law, rule, regulation, Receiving Party’s internal record-keeping policies or any electronic copies as may be stored on Receiving Party’s electronic records storage system as a result of automated back-up systems. Any Confidential Information so retained shall remain subject to this Agreement. 14. EVENTS OF DEFAULT, TERMINATION, REMEDIES, LIMITATION OF LIABILITY, SURVIVAL 14.1 Events of Default. The occurrence and continuation of any of the following events at any time during the term of this Agreement, except to the extent caused by, or resulting from, an act or omission of another Party in breach of this Agreement or an event of Force Majeure, will constitute an event of default (an “Event of Default”): 14.1.1 Payment. On and after the Effective Date, Lessor or Lessee fails to pay when due any amounts required to be paid by such Party under this Agreement and such failure to pay is not cured within fifteen Business Days following written notice from Manager or the other Party specifying the amount to be paid; provided, however, that such period will be extended for so long as the allegedly defaulting Party is disputing in good faith such amount pursuant to the procedures set forth in Article 15. 14.1.2 Other Defaults. A Party fails to cure any other failure to perform a material obligation under this Agreement within thirty (30) days following written notice from the other Party specifying the nature of the failure to perform, provided that if the default is not reasonably capable of being cured within thirty (30) days, then the default will be deemed cured if the defaulting Party commences, diligently pursues, and completes action that remedies the default within ninety (90) days of receipt of such notice. 14.1.3 Interconnection Agreement. A Party breaches, or causes the breach of, its applicable interconnection agreement, and the exercise of any remedies for such breach would have a material adverse effect on any of the Shared Facilities, this Agreement, the GIA, or the non-defaulting Party’s Project, and such defaulting Party fails to cure such breach within the time permitted by such agreement. Each Party agrees to provide a copy of any notice of default received by it to the Manager and the other Party under an applicable interconnection agreement (including, in the case of CV1, the GIA) as soon as practicable (and in any event within three (3) Business Days after receiving such notice of default), regardless of the party or the contract that is alleged to be in default in the notice. For the avoidance of doubt, CV2 is not able to be the defaulting Party under this Section 14.1.3 unless and until it has its own stand-alone generator interconnection agreement. 14.1.4 Bankruptcy. If a Party is adjudicated as bankrupt, becomes insolvent, enters into an arrangement or composition with the Party’s creditors, suffers permanent or temporary court-appointed receivership of substantially all of such Party’s property, makes a general assignment for the benefit of creditors, or files a voluntary bankruptcy petition. 14.2 Remedies. Upon the occurrence and during the continuation of an Event of Default, the other Party will have any and all of the following remedies, exercisable only after due inquiry that an Event of Default has occurred and is continuing: 14.2.1 Tender Performance. In its sole and absolute discretion, Lessor or Lessee may cure the default of the defaulting Party by making or tendering the required payment or performance (including by curing any default under the GIA), and permitting the defaulting Party’s Project to remain connected to the Shared Facilities and sales of electricity by the defaulting Party to be continued. 14.2.2 Disconnection. To the extent such Event of Default affects or relates to any Shared Facilities as determined by a final, non-appealable judgment of a court of competent jurisdiction, to cause the disconnection of the defaulting Party’s Project from such Shared Facilities; provided, however, that the defaulting Party’s Project will be permitted to reconnect promptly when and if the Event of Default is cured, and any and all damages suffered and incurred by the non defaulting Party as a result of such default have been compensated; provided, further, that this Section 14.2.2 shall in no event prohibit access to the Shared Facilities in the case of an Emergency in accordance with Section 3.3. 14.2.3 Specific Performance. The Parties agree that damages may be an inadequate remedy for an Event of Default under this Agreement, and that each of Lessor and Lessee will be entitled to seek injunctive and other equitable relief (including specific performance) against any other Party to prevent or eliminate such default. 14.2.4 Other Rights and Remedies. To exercise any and all other rights and remedies which the non-defaulting Parties might otherwise have under this Agreement, at law or in equity. 14.3 Reimbursement of Expenses to Cure; Lien. If Lessor or Lessee elects to cure an Event of Default of the other Party, the defaulting Party will reimburse the curing Party for its expenses incurred in rendering the cure, plus interest at the Default Rate. The Party curing the default will have a lien on the defaulting Party’s Ownership Interest (if the defaulting Party is Lessor) or Lease Interest (if the defaulting Party is Lessee), to the extent of the amount expended by the curing Party in remedying the default (including attorneys’ fees), and the defaulting Party hereby appoints the curing Party as its attorney-in-fact to file, record and otherwise assert such lien, to the extent of the expenditures in relation to such cure or remedy. 14.4 Remedies Cumulative. No right, remedy or election given by any term of this Agreement will be deemed exclusive but each will be cumulative with all other rights, remedies and elections available under this Agreement, at law or in equity. 14.5 Waiver of Partition. LESSOR AND LESSEE WILL NOT HAVE AND HEREBY WAIVE THE RIGHT TO PARTITION ALL OR ANY PORTION OF THE SHARED FACILITIES, OR TO MAKE APPLICATION TO ANY COURT OR AUTHORITY OR TO COMMENCE OR PROSECUTE ANY ACTION OR PROCEEDING FOR PARTITION OF THE SHARED FACILITIES. EACH PARTY WILL BE ENTITLED TO A DECREE OR ORDER RESTRAINING OR ENJOINING SUCH PARTITION, APPLICATION, ACTION OR PROCEEDING UPON ANY BREACH OF THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION 14.5. LESSOR AND LESSEE ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE THAT THEY HAVE BEEN PAID FULL CONSIDERATION FOR THE WAIVER PROVIDED IN THIS SECTION 14.5. 14.6 Limitation of Liability. NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF THIS AGREEMENT TO THE CONTRARY, IN NO EVENT, WHETHER AS A RESULT OF BREACH OF CONTRACT, TORT LIABILITY (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR STRICT LIABILITY), OR OTHERWISE, WILL ANY PARTY AND ENEL BE LIABLE TO ANY OTHER PARTY FOR SPECIAL, INDIRECT, PUNITIVE OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OF ANY NATURE WHATSOEVER, INCLUDING CLAIMS OF CUSTOMERS, COST OF MONEY, LOSS OF PROFIT, LOSS OF USE OF CAPITAL OR REVENUE, EXCEPT TO THE EXTENT SUCH DAMAGES ARE DUE UNDER ARTICLE 11 OR SECTION 6.12 ABOVE. NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF THIS AGREEMENT TO THE CONTRARY, IN NO EVENT, WHETHER AS A RESULT OF BREACH OF CONTRACT, TORT LIABILITY (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR STRICT LIABILITY), OR OTHERWISE, WILL THE AGGREGATE LIABILITY OF THE MANAGER ARISING UNDER THIS AGREEMENT EXCEED TWO HUNDRED THOUSAND DOLLARS ($200,000). 15. DISPUTE RESOLUTION Unless stated otherwise herein, all Disputes shall be resolved in accordance with the dispute resolution procedures set forth in Exhibit D. 16. MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS 17.1 Transfers. 17.1.1 Transfer of Ownership Interest or Lease Interest. No Party may Transfer its rights in the Ownership Interest or Lease Interest, as applicable, without obtaining the prior written consent other Party, such consent not to be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed. Any purported Transfer in contravention of this Section 17.1.1 is void. Any Transfer of all or a portion of the Ownership Interest or Lease Interest, as applicable, shall require that, as of the effective date of such Transfer, (1) the transferee will own the transferring Party’s Project, (2) the transferee agrees in writing to bound by all the terms and conditions of this Agreement in the place and stead of the transferring Party, and (3) all FERC and other required Governmental Approvals have been obtained (if necessary). If the procedures provided in this Section 17.1.1 are complied with, such transferring Party shall be released from any further obligations hereunder arising from and after the effective date of such Transfer. 17.1.2 Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, the Transfer of any direct or indirect interest in the membership interests in Lessor or Lessee in connection with any sale, merger, reorganization or tax equity financing shall be expressly permitted and shall not require the consent or approval of any other Party hereunder. 17.2 Right to Encumber. 17.2.1 Right to Encumber. Lessor or Lessee at any time may pledge, collaterally assign, encumber, or grant a security interest in its own Ownership Interest or Lease Interest, as applicable, and in its rights under this Agreement to any of its Financing Parties. Lessor and Lessee shall each, at any time and from time to time during the term of this Agreement, after receipt of a written request by the other Party, execute and deliver to the other Party and that Party’s Financing Parties, as designated in such request, such estoppel certificates and consents as may be reasonably requested thereby. 17.2.2 Pledge, Collateral Assignment or Encumbrance. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, to the extent Lessor or Lessee pledges, collaterally assigns or encumbers its Ownership Interest or Lease Interest, as applicable, and its rights under this Agreement as provided above, the Parties hereto expressly agree between themselves and for the benefit of any Financing Parties that (a) upon the occurrence of a default by a Party hereunder, the non-defaulting Party declaring the default shall also provide written notice to the Financing Parties (of which the Parties have notice) of such default (and accept their cure of such default), (b) each Financing Party shall have the same period after receipt of a notice of default to cure, or cause to be cured, the default described therein, as is given to the defaulting Party, plus, in each instance, the following additional time periods: (i) 30 days in the event of any monetary default; and (ii) 60 days in the event of any non-monetary default. The Parties agree that no Financing Party shall be obligated to perform any obligation or be deemed to incur any liability or obligation provided in this Agreement on either Party’s part or shall have any obligation or liability to either Party with respect to this Agreement except to the extent any Financing Party has assumed a Party’s obligations under this Agreement. 17.2.3 Expenses. All reasonable expenses, including reasonable attorneys’ fees, incurred by the Manager or any other Party in connection with the actual or proposed pledge, collateral assignment, encumbrance, or grant of a security interest in Lessor’s Ownership Interest or Lessee’s Lease Interest and their respective rights under this Agreement to a Financing Party, shall be paid by the assigning/borrowing Party to the Manager and respective Party upon request therefor. 17.2.4 Assignment by Manager. The Manager may not Transfer its rights under this Agreement without the prior written consent granted by the Required Consent (such consent not to be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed); provided, however, such restriction shall not apply to such a Transfer that is coincident with the Manager’s Transfer to the same transferee of its Ownership Interest or Lease Interest, as applicable, and its rights under this Agreement in its capacity as Lessor or Lessee, as applicable, in compliance with Section 17.1. 17.3 Reservation of Rights. Except as otherwise set forth herein, CV1 reserves all rights in the Shared Facilities not otherwise expressly granted to CV2 herein. 17.4 Governing Law. This Agreement is governed by the Laws of the State of New York, excluding any choice of law rules that would direct application of Laws of another jurisdiction; provided, however, the laws of the State of Oklahoma shall control this Agreement with respect to matters of conveyance and other real property and permitting matters necessarily subject to the laws of the State of Oklahoma. Each Party hereby irrevocably and unconditionally submits to the exclusive jurisdiction of any State court or federal court of the United States of America, in either case, sitting in New York, New York, and waives, to the fullest extent legally permissible, any objection which it may now or hereafter have to the personal jurisdiction of such courts or venue of any proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement in such courts and any defense of an inconvenient forum to the maintenance of such action or proceeding in such courts. IN ADDITION, EACH PARTY HEREBY WAIVES, TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, ANY RIGHT IT MAY HAVE TO A TRIAL BY JURY IN RESPECT OF ANY LITIGATION DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY ARISING OUT OF, UNDER OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT. 17.5 Compliance with Laws. This Agreement is subject to all present and future Laws, including valid orders, rules and regulations of any Governmental Authority having jurisdiction over the Shared Facilities, the Projects or the Parties. 17.6 Survival. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, the provisions of this Section 17.6 (Survival), Article 11 (Indemnification), Article 13 (Confidentiality), Section 14.4 (Remedies Cumulative), Section 14.6 (Limitation of Liability), and Article 15 and Exhibit D (Dispute Resolution) are intended to and shall survive termination of this Agreement so as to cover all claims instituted within the period set forth in the applicable statute of limitations. 17.7 Effect of Waiver. The Parties and Enel agree that no failure or delay by a Party in exercising any right, power or privilege under this Agreement shall operate as a waiver thereof, unless such waiver is made expressly and confirmed in writing by the Party against whom such waiver would be enforced, nor shall any single or partial exercise by a Party of any right, power or privilege hereunder preclude any other or future exercise thereof. 17.8 Severability. Any provision of this Agreement that is prohibited or unenforceable in any jurisdiction shall, as to that jurisdiction, be ineffective to the extent of that prohibition or unenforceability without invalidating the remaining provisions hereof or affecting the validity or enforceability of that provision in any other jurisdiction. 17.9 Entire Agreement; Amendments. This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement among the Parties and Enel pertaining to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior agreements, representations, communications and understandings, written or oral, express or implied, pertaining thereto. Any modifications, amendments, or changes to this Agreement shall be binding upon the Parties and Enel only if agreed upon in writing and signed by the authorized representatives of the Parties and Enel and shall be subject to any requisite Governmental Approvals. 17.10 Not for the Benefit of Third Parties. This Agreement is intended to be solely for the benefit of the Parties and Enel and their respective successors and permitted assignees, and is not intended to and shall not confer any rights or benefits on any party not a signatory hereto. 17.11 Counterparts. This Agreement may be executed in a number of identical counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument, notwithstanding that all of the Parties and Enel are not signatories to the original or to the same counterpart. A copy of this Agreement signed by a Party or Enel and delivered by facsimile transmission to the other Parties and Enel shall have the same effect as the delivery of an original of this Agreement containing the original signature of such first-mentioned Party or Enel. 17.12 Further Assurances. Each of the Parties and Enel agrees to provide such information, execute and deliver any instruments and documents, and to take such other actions as may be necessary or reasonably requested by the other Parties or Enel, which are not inconsistent with the provisions of this Agreement and which do not involve assumptions of obligations or materially affect the cost of performance, other than those provided for in this Agreement, in order to give full effect to this Agreement and to carry out the intent of this Agreement. 17.13 Non-Recourse. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, except with respect to Enel’s obligations under Section 11.1, no Party or Enel shall have any claims, obligations, liabilities or causes of action (whether in contract or tort, in law or in equity, or granted by statute, including without limitation those that may be available to avoid or disregard the entity form of a Party or Enel) with respect to or arising out of the transactions contemplated by this Agreement against (a) any member or any other present or future holder (whether direct or indirect) of any equity interests in a Party or Enel, (b) any of their respective affiliates (other than a Party or Enel) or (c) any officers, directors, employees, representatives, executives or agents of any of the foregoing, such claims, obligations, liabilities and causes of action, to the maximum extent permitted by law, being expressly waived. 17.14 Successors and Assigns. Except as otherwise permitted herein, neither Party nor Enel may assign its rights or obligations under this Agreement without the other Party’s and Enel’s (or, in the case of assignment by Enel, CV1’s) prior written consent, which consent may not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed. This Agreement will be binding on, and inure to the benefit of, the Parties and Enel and their successors and permitted assigns. 17.15 Interpretation 17.15.1 Headings. The titles, captions and headings in this Agreement are inserted for convenience only and will not be used for the purposes of construing or interpreting this Agreement. 17.15.2 References in this Agreement. In this Agreement, unless a clear, contrary intention appears: (a) the singular includes the plural and vice versa; (b) reference to any Person includes such Person’s successors and assigns but, in the case of a Party, only if such assigns are permitted by this Agreement, and reference to a Person in a particular capacity excludes such Person in any other capacity; (c) pronouns and reference to any gender includes each other gender; (d) reference to any agreement (including this Agreement), document or instrument means such agreement, document or instrument as amended or modified and in effect from time to time in accordance with the terms thereof and, if applicable, the terms of this Agreement; (e) reference to any Law means such Law as amended, modified, codified or reenacted, in whole or in part, and in effect from time to time, including, if applicable, rules and regulations promulgated thereunder; (f) reference to any Section means such Section of this Agreement, and references in any Section or definition to any clause means such clause of such Section or definition; (g) “hereunder,” “hereof,” “hereto” and words of similar import will be deemed references to this Agreement as a whole and not to any particular Section or other provision of this Agreement; (h) “including” (and with correlative meaning “include”) means including without limitation; and (i) relative to the determination of any period of time, “from” means “from and including”, “to” means “to but excluding” and “through” means “through and including”. 17.15.3 Industry Meanings. Words and abbreviations not defined in this Agreement that have well-known technical or power industry meanings in the United States are used in this Agreement in accordance with those recognized meanings. 17.15.4 Joint Responsibility for Drafting. This Agreement was negotiated and prepared by the Parties and Enel with advice of counsel to the extent deemed necessary by each Party and Enel. The Parties and Enel have agreed to the wording of this Agreement, and none of the provisions of this Agreement will be construed against one Party on the ground that such Party is the author of this Agreement or any part of this Agreement. 17.15.5 Incorporation of Exhibits. The Exhibits attached to this Agreement are incorporated into this Agreement by reference for all purposes. All of the components within the CV1 Substation are shared except the feeder breakers for each collection circuit, the ground transformers (one for each collection circuit), and the metering system (one set of meters calculates total output and one set calculates CV2 output, but outputs from both are required to calculate CV1 output). EXHIBIT B Percentage Interest of Lessor and Lessee Lessor – 78.4% Lessee – 21.6% EXHIBIT C Insurance Requirements Each of Lessor and Lessee shall obtain and maintain at its expense the insurance described below under individual or blanket policies with insurance companies that are licensed or authorized to do business in the State of Oklahoma and are rated “A-” with a minimum size rating of “VII” or better by A.M. Best or otherwise approved by the Required Consent. A. “All Risks” Property insurance, including physical damage, property damage, boiler and machinery coverage, earthquake, flood, business interruption and extra expense with a deductible not to exceed two hundred fifty thousand dollars ($250,000) for plant equipment and property. Business interruption shall have a waiting period of not greater than 90 days. This insurance shall not contain any exclusion for operator error in the performance of its services hereunder. Such insurance shall provide coverage on a replacement cost basis for the applicable Project. B. Comprehensive General Liability insurance covering third party claims for bodily injury, death, and property damage arising from premise operations with a limit of liability of not less than one million dollars ($1,000,000) per occurrence and two million dollars ($2,000,000) in the aggregate. C. Comprehensive Automobile Liability insurance, for a Party’s protection, covering claims for bodily injury, death, and property damage arising out of the use of all owned (if any), leased (if any), non-owned and hired motor vehicles including loading and unloading with a one million dollars ($1,000,000) minimum limit per occurrence for combined bodily injury and property damage. D. (1) To the extent required by applicable law, Workers’ Compensation insurance with statutory limits, including an all states’ endorsement, and (2) Employer’s Liability insurance for all employees of a Party with a minimum limit of one million dollars ($1,000,000) per occurrence. E. Umbrella Excess Liability insurance on an occurrence or claims-made basis in an amount resulting in total coverage when combined with primary layers required by clauses (B), (C), and (D)(2) of no less than twenty million dollars ($20,000,000) per occurrence, covering claims in excess of and following the terms of the underlying insurance as set forth in clauses (B), (C), and (D)(2). EXHIBIT D Dispute Resolution Procedures A. Each Party shall appoint one (1) person to coordinate with the other Party regarding the performance of this Agreement (each a “Representative” and collectively the “Representatives”). If any dispute arises with respect to either Party’s performance under this Agreement, the Representatives shall meet to attempt to resolve such dispute, either in person or by telephone, within five (5) business days after the written request of either Representative. Except as otherwise provided hereunder, if the Representatives are unable to resolve such dispute, a senior officer of CV1 and a senior officer of CV2 shall meet, either in person or by telephone, within ten (10) business days after either Representative provides written notice that the Representatives have been unable to resolve such dispute, to attempt to resolve the dispute. B. Any disputes arising out of, in connection with or with respect to this Agreement, the subject matter hereof, the performance or non-performance of any obligation hereunder, that cannot be resolved in accordance with Section A of this Exhibit D, shall be adjudicated in a state or federal court of competent civil jurisdiction sitting in the State of New York. Each of the Parties irrevocably consents and agrees that any legal action or proceedings with respect to this Agreement may be brought in the courts of the State of New York or the United States of America for the District of New York having subject matter jurisdiction and, by execution and delivery of this Agreement and such other documents executed in connection herewith, each Party (i) accepts the exclusive jurisdiction of the aforesaid courts, (ii) irrevocably agrees to be bound by any final judgment (after any and all appeals) of any such court with respect to such documents, (iii) irrevocably waives, to the fullest extent permitted by law, any objection to the laying of venue of any suit, action or proceedings with respect to such documents brought in any such court, and further irrevocably waives, to the fullest extent permitted by law, any claim that any such suit, action or proceedings brought in any such court has been brought in any inconvenient forum, (iv) agrees that service of process in any such action may be effected by mailing a copy thereof by registered or certified mail (or any substantially similar form of mail), postage prepaid, to such Party at its address set forth below, or at such other address of which the other Party hereto has been notified and (v) agrees that nothing herein will affect the right to effect service of process in any other manner permitted by law or limit the right to bring any suit, action or proceeding in any other jurisdiction. EXHIBIT E Form of Memorandum of Shared Facilities Agreement MEMORANDUM OF SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT THIS MEMORANDUM OF SHARED FACILITIES AGREEMENT (this “Memorandum”) is entered into as of ______________, 2016 (the “Effective Date”) by and among CHISHOLM VIEW WIND PROJECT, LLC, a New York limited liability company (“CV1” or “Lessor”), CHISHOLM VIEW WIND PROJECT II, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“CV2” or “Lessee”) and Enel Green Power North America, Inc., a Delaware corporation (“Enel”). Each of CV1 and CV2 are referred to herein as a “Party,” and collectively CV1 and CV2 are referred to as the “Parties”. Capitalized terms used but not defined in this Memorandum have the meanings given to them in the Shared Facilities Agreement dated as of the Effective Date by and among the Parties and Enel (the “Agreement”). A. CV1 owns and operates a wind generation facility located in Grant and Garfield Counties, Oklahoma and that consists of wind turbine generators, foundations and towers and associated collection and interconnection lines and related facilities and improvements (the "CV1 Project"). B. CV2 desires to install, own and operate a wind generation facility (the "CV2 Project"), which will be constructed in Grant County, Oklahoma, adjacent to the CV1 Project. Together, the CV1 Project and CV2 Project shall be referred to as the "Projects." C. CV1 owns, operates, and maintains a 345 kV substation, interconnection line and other associated facilities, including a switchyard, breakers, substation, capacitor banks, SCADA and WindControl systems and metering, all more particularly described as the “Shared Facilities” in the Agreement (the "Shared Facilities"). As of the Effective Date, CV1 owns one hundred percent (100%) of the interests in the Shared Facilities. D. CV1 is the owner of certain leasehold rights encumbering certain land in Garfield and Grant County more particularly described on “Exhibit A” attached hereto (the “CV1 Real Property Interests”). E. CV1 and CV2 desire for CV2 to lease, or acquire a co-tenancy ownership interest in, the Shared Facilities from CV1 to the extent needed for, and in order to support, CV2’s development and operation of the CV2 Project and for CV2 to acquire certain sub-easement, sublease and access rights in the CV1 Real Property Interests in connection thereto. F. The Parties have executed and acknowledged this Memorandum and are recording the same for the purpose of providing notice of the Agreement and certain of the Parties’ rights and obligations thereunder. Capitalized terms used and not defined herein have the meaning given the same in the Agreement. AGREEMENT: NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants contained in the Agreement and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows: Effective Date. The Agreement will commence on the Effective Date and remain in full force and effect following the Effective Date until the first occurrence of (a) the mutual agreement of the Parties and Enel to terminate the Agreement, or (b) otherwise as provided under the Agreement. Grant of Lease in Shared Facilities. Effective upon the Effective Date, upon and subject to the terms, conditions, restrictions and reservations set forth in the Agreement, CV1 has leased to CV2 an undivided twenty-one and six tenths percent (21.6%) leasehold interest in and to the Shared Facilities owned or hereafter acquired by CV1, while at the same time reserving to itself 100% ownership interest in and to such Shared Facilities. Grant of Easements. Pursuant to the Agreement, CV1 has irrevocably granted to CV2 and its successors and assigns, subject to the terms of the Agreement, sub-easements and sublease rights over, across and under the CV1 Real Property Interests for the purposes of constructing, operating and maintaining the Shared Facilities and ingress and egress over and across all access roads on the CV1 Real Property Interests for access thereto. CV2 Purchase Option. Pursuant to the Agreement, CV2 has a one-time option (the “CV2 Purchase Option”) to elect to purchase an undivided ownership interest in 21.6% of the Shared Facilities. Access to Shared Facilities. Each of Lessor and Lessee and their respective Representatives shall have access to the Shared Facilities (a) for inspection of the Shared Facilities, (b) for any required maintenance and repairs of the Shared Facilities as agreed to by Lessor, Lessee and the Manager, if applicable, and (c) in connection with the operation of the Shared Facilities, all in accordance with the Agreement. No Dedication of Property; No Public Access. Each Party agrees that entering into the Agreement, performing its obligations thereunder or hereunder, or exercising its rights thereunder or hereunder, either in whole or part, is not intended to be, and shall in no way be construed as or deemed to be a dedication to public or quasi-public use or purpose of any of the Project Specific Assets of the Party, the Project Specific Assets of another Party, any Shared Facilities, or any portion of the foregoing. Co-Location Rights. Pursuant to the Agreement, each of Lessor and Lessee shall be permitted to encroach upon the Shared Facilities with its Project Specific Assets (including collection lines) solely to the extent necessary to develop, construct, operate and/or maintain its Project, provided that any such encroachments or overhang shall be subject to the noninterference protections of Section 3.4 of the Agreement. In particular, Lessor’s or Lessee’s exercise of rights under Section 6.9 of the Agreement shall only be permitted in accordance with Prudent Industry Practices, and shall not interfere with or endanger the construction, operation, or maintenance of the transmission lines, substations, or operations and maintenance facilities components of the Shared Facilities. In the event of a conflict in the location or operation of the Shared Facilities and any Project Specific Assets, the Shared Facilities shall take priority over the Project Specific Assets. Notice. All notices and other communications required or permitted by the Agreement or by applicable Law to be served upon or given to a Party by another Party shall be in writing and shall be deemed duly served, given and received (a) on the date of service, if served personally or sent by facsimile (with appropriate confirmation of receipt) or other electronic transmission to the Party to whom notice is to be given, or (b) on date of receipt, if mailed by certified mail, postage prepaid, return receipt requested, or (c) on the date of receipt if sent by a nationally recognized courier for next day service and so addressed as follows: If to CV1, to: c/o Enel Green Power North America, Inc. One Tech Drive, Suite 220 Andover, MA 01810 Attention: General Counsel Governing Law. The Agreement is governed by the Laws of the State of New York, excluding any choice of law rules that would direct application of Laws of another jurisdiction; provided, however, the laws of the State of Oklahoma shall control the Agreement with respect to matters of conveyance and other real property and permitting matters necessarily subject to the laws of the State of Oklahoma. Each Party hereby irrevocably and unconditionally submits to the exclusive jurisdiction of any State court or federal court of the United States of America, in either case, sitting in New York, New York, and waives, to the fullest extent legally permissible, any objection which it may now or hereafter have to the personal jurisdiction of such courts or venue of any proceeding arising out of or relating to the Agreement in such courts and any defense of an inconvenient forum to the maintenance of such action or proceeding in such courts. IN ADDITION, EACH PARTY HEREBY WAIVES, TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, ANY RIGHT IT MAY HAVE TO A TRIAL BY JURY IN RESPECT OF ANY LITIGATION DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY ARISING OUT OF, UNDER OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE AGREEMENT. Compliance with Laws. The Agreement is subject to all present and future Laws, including valid orders, rules and regulations of any Governmental Authority having jurisdiction over the Shared Facilities, the Projects or the Parties. Effect of Waiver. The Parties and Enel agree that no failure or delay by a Party in exercising any right, power or privilege under the Agreement shall operate as a waiver thereof, unless such waiver is made expressly and confirmed in writing by the Party against whom such waiver would be enforced, nor shall any single or partial exercise by a Party of any right, power or privilege hereunder preclude any other or future exercise thereof. Severability. Any provision of the Agreement that is prohibited or unenforceable in any jurisdiction shall, as to that jurisdiction, be ineffective to the extent of that prohibition or unenforceability without invalidating the remaining provisions hereof or affecting the validity or enforceability of that provision in any other jurisdiction. Entire Agreement; Amendments. The Agreement constitutes the entire agreement among the Parties and Enel pertaining to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior agreements, representations, communications and understandings, written or oral, express or implied, pertaining thereto. Any modifications, amendments, or changes to the Agreement shall be binding upon the Parties and Enel only if agreed upon in writing and signed by the authorized representatives of the Parties and Enel and shall be subject to any requisite Governmental Approvals. Not for the Benefit of Third Parties. The Agreement is intended to be solely for the benefit of the Parties and Enel and their respective successors and permitted assignees, and is not intended to and shall not confer any rights or benefits on any party not a signatory hereto. Counterparts. This Memorandum may be executed in a number of identical counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument, notwithstanding that all of the Parties and Enel are not signatories to the same counterpart. Successors and Assigns. Except as otherwise permitted therein, no Party or Enel may assign its rights or obligations under the Agreement without the other Party’s and Enel’s (or, in the case of assignment by Enel, CV1’s) prior written consent, which consent may not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed. The Agreement will be binding on, and inure to the benefit of, the Parties and Enel and their successors and permitted assigns. SCHEDULE 6.15 Metering Protocol [Attached.] Chisholm View I + II Metering Oct. 25, 2016 Revision 4 Chisholm View I + II Metering Configuration I. Definitions II. Substation Overview III. Instantaneous Metering Calculations IV. Energy Calculations I. Chisholm View I + II Metering Configuration CV1: Chisholm View I Wind Project CV2: Chisholm View II Wind Project RM: OGE Revenue Meter OGE_MW: Instantaneous power at the Point of Interconnect. OGE_MWHR: Energy production at the Point of Interconnect. OGE_MWH_LstHr : Energy production at the Point of Interconnect produced during in the last hour CV1_MW: Instantaneous power produced by Chisholm View I. CV1_MWHR: Energy production for Chisholm View I. CV1_ MW10sec_LstHr: The accumulated energy for Chisholm View II using samples taken every 10 seconds. CV2_MW: Instantaneous power produced by Chisholm View II. CV2_MWHR: Energy production for Chisholm View II. CV2_MW10sec_LstHr: The accumulated energy for Chisholm View II using samples taken every 10 seconds. 10/11/2016 Chisholm View II, USA 3 Definitions F16_MW: New 34.5kV meter measuring instantaneous power produced by Chisholm View II on bus 1. F26_MW: New 34.5kV meter measuring instantaneous power produced by Chisholm View II on bus 2. MT1_MW: New 34.5kV meter measuring instantaneous power at the 34.5kV terminals of Main Power Transformer 1. MT2_MW: New 34.5kV meter measuring instantaneous power at the 34.5kV terminals of Main Power Transformer 2. RTAC: Real Time Automation Controller II. Chisholm View I + II Metering Configuration Substation Overview P = Real Power (what we get paid for) Q = Reactive Power (used to comply with power factor requirements at the POI) V = Voltage I = Current pf = Power Factor III. Instantaneous Metering Calculations Instantaneous Power (MW) uses real-time MW values from all five meters, and is calculated every 10 seconds. The values from the new meters (MT1, MT2, F16 and F26) are used to ratio CV1 and CV2. This ratio is then applied to the total of CV1 and CV2 at the Revenue Meter so that the net total of CV1 and CV2 power and energy always equal the total at the Revenue Meter. 10/11/2016 Chisholm View II, USA 5 CV2_MW = OGE_MW * (F16_MW + F26_MW) / (MT1_MW + MT2_MW) CV1_MW = OGE_MW – CV2_MW IV. Energy Calculations 10/11/2016 Chisholm View II, USA 6 Energy Production (MWH) uses a counter in the OGandE meter, and counters in the RTAC for CV1 and CV2. Once each hour (at 6 seconds past the top of the hour), the OGandE energy counter and the RTAC counters are used determine the previous hour’s energy production. The OGandE meter is the controlling meter, and the values from the RTAC counters are used to ratio the OGandE previous hour energy value on a percentage basis between CV1 and CV2 such that the total of CV1 and CV2 always equal the controlling meter. Annex 1: Energy Calculations 10/11/2016 Chisholm View II, USA 7 At 6 seconds past the top of the hour, the RTAC processes the following: Record the current OGandE_MWHR counter and RTAC accumulators. Subtract the current OGandE_MWHR counter and RTAC accumulators from the values recorded one hour previously. Check for counter/accumulator rollovers and process accordingly. This provides the last hour of energy as measured by the OGandE meter, and the last hour of energy for each of CV1 and CV2 as sampled every 10 seconds. CV2_MWH_LstHr = OGE_MWH_LstHr * CV2_MW10sec_LstHr / (CV1_ MW10sec_LstHr + CV2_ MW10sec_LstHr) CV1_MWH_LstHr = OGE_MWH_LstHr – CV2_MWH_LstHr
